commit_message:
libvirt: set discard for all drives

The initial discard patch only implemented this on image backend, which
makes the discard option setting inconsitent between drives.

This patches fixes that and clean up the code.

Change-Id: I1f63f03c31d9592c33d147b6836684307b246bd5

commit_message:
Adds infrastructure for microversioned api samples

This adds the necessary infrastructure to support the generation
and testing of microversioned api samples. The new api sample tests
require a request_api_version class attribute which
defines what api version is requested when running the tests and
where the api samples are stored for this specific version

Partially implements bp api-microversions
Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Change-Id: I6ea8ec1b4e2439d8d2c856c399d31af838a3edf8

subject: Add message about preloading subunit streams
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-13 16:40:42.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': "Add message about preloading subunit streams

This commit adds a simple message to explain that it's loading old
subunit streams into testr. Without this the output from testr load
is slightly confusing because it is essentially:

    /opt/stack/new/devstack
    /opt/stack/new/tempest /opt/stack/new/devstack
    Ran 1396 (+919) tests in 1229.000s (-611.000s)

repeated 10 times.

commit_message:
Add message about preloading subunit streams

This commit adds a simple message to explain that it's loading old
subunit streams into testr. Without this the output from testr load
is slightly confusing because it is essentially:

    /opt/stack/new/devstack
    /opt/stack/new/tempest /opt/stack/new/devstack
    Ran 1396 (+919) tests in 1229.000s (-611.000s)
    PASSED (id=2, skips=124)

repeated 10 times.

Change-Id: I6549c78d62379da1eadc51e3015003cdcf1cae62

init file.

Partial-Bug: 1422281
Backport: Juno

subject: BaseAgentVendor: Invoke the driver vendor interface from task
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-16 14:34:46.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/agent_base_vendor.py'], 'message': 'BaseAgentVendor: Invoke the driver vendor interface from task

The BaseAgentVendor is a base class that drivers vendor interfaces that
uses IPA as the deploy ramdisk can inherit from. As the method heartbeat()
is exposed in the API (via @passthru decorator) if more than one driver
inherit from the base class, the mapping to that method could point to
any of the instances. Therefor we need to explicity call the overwritten
methods directly from the task object that is passed by parameter.

Change-Id: Ib38d2451d05d9c3d185691748c10693a4615b5b2
'}]
commit_message:
BaseAgentVendor: Invoke the driver vendor interface from task

The BaseAgentVendor is a base class that drivers vendor interfaces that
uses IPA as the deploy ramdisk can inherit from. As the method heartbeat()
is exposed in the API (via @passthru decorator) if more than one driver
inherit from the base class, the mapping to that method could point to
any of the instances. Therefor we need to explicity call the overwritten
methods directly from the task object that is passed by parameter.

Change-Id: Ib38d2451d05d9c3d185691748c10693a4615b5b2

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 425, 'name': 'Darren Birkett', 'email': 'darren.birkett@gmail.com', 'username': 'darren-birkett'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7217, 'name': 'Hugh Saunders', 'email': 'hugh@wherenow.org', 'username': 'hughsaunders'}, {'_account_id': 7219, 'name': 'git-harry', 'email': 'git-harry@live.co.uk', 'username': 'git-harry'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 9884, 'name': 'Wherenow.org CI', 'email': 'jenkins@wherenow.org', 'username': 'wherenowjenkins', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12892, 'name': 'Nolan Brubaker', 'email': 'nolan.brubaker@rackspace.com', 'username': 'nrb'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2015-02-16 09:14:27.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/ansible.cfg', 'playbooks/plugins/connection_plugins/ssh_retry.py'], 'message': 'Add ssh_retry connection plugin

The default ssh connection plugin will cause a task to fail if a
connection cannot be made first time. The failures have been found to
cause a number of builds to fail.

This patch adds a new connection plugin called ssh_retry and sets it as
the default one to use.

The plugin can be enabled by setting the following options in
ansible.cfg:

    [defaults]
    connection_plugins = plugins/connection_plugins
    transport = ssh_retry

    [ssh_retry]
    retries = 3

Note, the default retries is 3.

Change-Id: Ic187fb154cfa7b6fa95b19bee4757ec976f3f368
Co-Authored-By: Hugh Saunders <hugh@wherenow.org>
Closes-Bug: #1404343
'}]
commit_message:
Add ssh_retry connection plugin

The default ssh connection plugin will cause a task to fail if a
connection cannot be made first time. The failures have been found to
cause a number of builds to fail.

This patch adds a new connection plugin called ssh_retry and sets it as
the default one to use.

The plugin can be enabled by setting the following options in
ansible.cfg:

    [defaults]
    connection_plugins = plugins/connection_plugins
    transport = ssh_retry

    [ssh_retry]
    retries = 3

Note, the default retries is 3.

Change-Id: Ic187fb154cfa7b6fa95b19bee4757ec976f3f368
Co-Authored-By: Hugh Saunders <hugh@wherenow.org>
Closes-Bug: #1404343

commit_message:
Add suggestion to dev docs for debugging odd test failures

Adds information about the -r flag for tox to refresh the venv when
running unitests as when this happens the failures can look odd or valid
failures can be missing when running on a local system but occur when running
in the gate.

Change-Id: Ie6f7f73dfdbd4e55e8ac0b8a66cf9661f5630a09

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-13 18:41:32.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/context.py'], 'message': "Removed error log for failure inside individual thread

We don't want to have all errors from all threads logged on
ERROR level. E.g. in case of network failure and 10 parallel VM
tasks there will be 10 stacktraces in the logs. Parent thread
will receive the first exception and in most cases it is enough
to treat operation over all threads as errored.

Change-Id: Idc93c33f41d502e5aa0149b93ce816379c1043b1
Closes-Bug: #1421032
"}]
commit_message:
Removed error log for failure inside individual thread

We don't want to have all errors from all threads logged on
ERROR level. E.g. in case of network failure and 10 parallel VM
tasks there will be 10 stacktraces in the logs. Parent thread
will receive the first exception and in most cases it is enough
to treat operation over all threads as errored.

Change-Id: Idc93c33f41d502e5aa0149b93ce816379c1043b1
Closes-Bug: #1421032

commit_message:
Do not compute deltas when doing migration

'resize' is reused by 'migration' when don't pass a flavor_id,
no need to compute the delta if flavor_id is not provided.

commit_message:
Remove 'DefaultDNS' and 'useDefaultDNS' options

If no nameserver list is provided to a neutron subnet,
it uses the DHCP (gateway) address which in turn forwards to dnsmasq.

So dns_nameservers will be set to emptylist in heat.

Closes-Bug: #1367877

Change-Id: Idba201f13c8648b9063584fa9c5844b99cbc3b51

commit_message:
oslo.messaging: don't execute functional tests for stable branches

Change I048c42d3251874e10c6a1cc0f56206adda9d7968 broke stable branches
since functional tests are not available in any branches other than
master.

We should not execute those jobs for stable branches at all, so apply
appropriate branch filter.

Change-Id: I03255c70b2a64b3168aebc2b5e259e0feeab7ac8

subject: Proxy settings fixes and improvements
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-01-06 05:00:51.000000000', 'files': ['Vagrantfile', 'config.yaml.sample'], 'message': 'Proxy settings fixes and improvements

When used proxy some extra settings has to be set in order to make the
environment work as expected.

  * Add hostname_manager, hostname_computer from yaml.conf file
  * Add user_domains to add customs domains/ips to no_proxy variable
  * Add manager ip/hostname to /etc/hosts if private ips is chosen
  * Add ipaddress_eth1 for no_proxy
  * Add compute and manager ips
  * Add https proxy
  * Add use https:// instead of git:// if http_proxy is enabled

Change-Id: I5ddde4dc510dc9aadff634515fa7d34371708de9
'}]
commit_message:
Proxy settings fixes and improvements

When used proxy some extra settings has to be set in order to make the
environment work as expected.

  * Add hostname_manager, hostname_computer from yaml.conf file
  * Add user_domains to add customs domains/ips to no_proxy variable
  * Add manager ip/hostname to /etc/hosts if private ips is chosen
  * Add ipaddress_eth1 for no_proxy
  * Add compute and manager ips
  * Add https proxy
  * Add use https:// instead of git:// if http_proxy is enabled

Change-Id: I5ddde4dc510dc9aadff634515fa7d34371708de9

Outerjoin (LEFT OUTER JOIN) replace on join (INNER JOIN)
because here join is more fit and work a little bit faster.
Also comment for this function has been corrected, because
.first() return None, but not empty list.

Co-Authored-By: Eugeniya Kudryashova <ekudryashova@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Change outer to inner join in fixed IP DB API func

Outerjoin (LEFT OUTER JOIN) replace on join (INNER JOIN)
because here join is more fit and work a little bit faster.
Also comment for this function has been corrected, because
.first() return None, but not empty list.

Co-Authored-By: Eugeniya Kudryashova <ekudryashova@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I86e06f65c397da7f280d4db7dbe98d7a389a7a5a

commit_message:
Implement api samples test for os-baremetal-nodes Part 2

Implements an API sample test for a GET request for os-baremetal-nodes
which was previously manually generated and wrong. Removes api samples
for add-interface, create, and remove-interface which were removed
for os-baremetal-nodes at some point.

This should bring the os-baremetal-nodes plugin in sync with reality
for both v2 and v2.1

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Ibd55b43368485b7f460ef6564f611df136275562

commit_message:
Improvement in 'network_set_host' function

'select for update' in 'network_set_host' function
was replaced by single 'update' operation,
the problems with MySQL Galera and 'select for update'
relate to spec https://review.openstack.org/#/c/135296

Now 'network_set_host' method returns number of updated rows
in database.

Change-Id: I3fbf1a54a646466d1e1322bb291bfec462af1355

commit_message:
Run tests under Python-2.7

In order to support Python-2.7 it's necessary
to run tests under it. This patch introduces options
that allow running tests either under py-27 or py-26
or under both versions of Python.

Blueprint: re-thinking-fuel-client
Change-Id: I4374d91c57fb8241ce2a7bf84c56a51c897f0be2

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-12 09:32:00.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/log/log.py'], 'message': "Make use_syslog=True log to syslog via /dev/log

After upgrade from Icehouse to Juno OpenStack services don't log to
syslog via /dev/log anymore. This behaviour was introduced in commit
1188d88a73e75da5c143d0dfad34e10dad0daee0. While /dev/log is arguably
not a very portable default, breaking the backwards compatibility is
even worse.

This commit restores the original behaviour. /dev/log portability
issues will be addressed separately.

Closes-Bug: #1385295
Related-Bug: #1391428

Change-Id: I4e84bca70eee6d6aa8d7525fe38d65ba235dd6b0
"}]
commit_message:
Make use_syslog=True log to syslog via /dev/log

After upgrade from Icehouse to Juno OpenStack services don't log to
syslog via /dev/log anymore. This behaviour was introduced in commit
1188d88a73e75da5c143d0dfad34e10dad0daee0. While /dev/log is arguably
not a very portable default, breaking the backwards compatibility is
even worse.

This commit restores the original behaviour. /dev/log portability
issues will be addressed separately.

Closes-Bug: #1385295
Related-Bug: #1391428

Change-Id: I4e84bca70eee6d6aa8d7525fe38d65ba235dd6b0

subject: Support ssl cert verification on outgoing https
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-02-16 11:08:14.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/engine1/test_action_context.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/services/test_action_manager.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/actions/test_std_http_action.py', 'mistral/actions/std_actions.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/utils/test_inspect_utils.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine1/test_action_defaults.py'], 'message': 'Support ssl cert verification on outgoing https

Added the verify parameter to HttpAction class so that a ca bundle
 can be used to verify ssl certs when making outgoing https calls
 via HttpAction
Modified unit tests to expect added parameter

commit_message:
Support ssl cert verification on outgoing https

Added the verify parameter to HttpAction class so that a ca bundle
 can be used to verify ssl certs when making outgoing https calls
 via HttpAction
Modified unit tests to expect added parameter
Corrected name of test_inspect_utils.py as it was under the knife
 in any case

Change-Id: I444b22eabf7c48db62f29a59421aaa290b5f0cd7

In part 1 of the patch series(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/155171/),
two new taskspec definitions were added: DirectWorkflowTaskSpec and
ReverseWorkflowTaskSpec, corresponding to 'direct' and 'reverse'
workflow types. This patch makes the taskspecs retrieve behavior in a

commit_message:
Task specification improvement(Part 2)

In part 1 of the patch series(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/155171/),
two new taskspec definitions were added: DirectWorkflowTaskSpec and
ReverseWorkflowTaskSpec, corresponding to 'direct' and 'reverse'
workflow types. This patch makes the taskspecs retrieve behavior in a
more generic way, rather than hardcode the workflow type.

Partially Implements: blueprint mistral-specifications-design-improvements

Change-Id: I69b71eeef9fb4d55865b48a017acfdcebbc4f196

The "splice-auto" options causes HAProxy to evaluate splice() system
call performance using light heuristic, independently for requests and
responses. The possible gain of splicing depends on too many factors and
might be dependent on used hardware so there is no point in hardcoding

commit_message:
Let HAProxy determine usefulness of TCP splicing

The "splice-auto" options causes HAProxy to evaluate splice() system
call performance using light heuristic, independently for requests and
responses. The possible gain of splicing depends on too many factors and
might be dependent on used hardware so there is no point in hardcoding
it.

Change-Id: I06e106eaacf9c67a9ef1582a37b5c46209fb0c2b
Closes-Bug: 1420710
(cherry picked from commit ea938a425423ec68174e10ef6de4c2fa4429304c)

commit_message:
Reboot tasks for pre/post deployment tasks

Extend support of pre/post actions with 'reboot' operation
It is apply only one parameters 'timeout' which mean -
how much time we should wait after sending reboot command
to detect fact of node restarting.

Support fail_if_error behavior.

Implements blueprint reboot-action-for-plugin
Change-Id: Id1fcc6028e92c6cd6ff50184271fb2f5967537df

commit_message:
Do not call get_json() in TestPost

Currently for the test cases in TestPost, it always call post_json
first then get_json to get detail for object, but actually, there is
already object info in the return value for post_json.

This patch is removing get_json for those cases and use values
returned by post_json directly.

The objects covered in this patch include:
1) bay
2) baymodel
3) node
4) service
5) replication controller
6) pod

Implements part of bp increase-test-coverage

Change-Id: Ic9f5106943c05bf80730972906a37e263e5a8893

subject: Specify the default floating IP pool in nova.conf
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 7227, 'name': 'Timur Nurlygayanov', 'email': 'tnurlygayanov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'tnurlygayanov'}, {'_account_id': 7468, 'name': 'Sergey Vasilenko', 'email': 'svasilenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'xenolog'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-16 11:21:24.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/controller.pp'], 'message': 'Specify the default floating IP pool in nova.conf

For now no default floating IP pool is specified in nova.conf
when Neutron is deployed. This causes some problems. For example,
when executing the command `nova floating-ip-create` we will have
the following error:

ERROR (NotFound): Floating ip pool not found. (HTTP 404)

This issue happens only if floating IP pool is not provided to
the command. The workaround is to provide pool to the command
as an argument, but it is convenient to have the default pool
and execute commands without extra arguments.

Closes-Bug: #1370448

Change-Id: I2c0f8659ed7c0afd925e2d468fa6019b1083e4a8
'}]
commit_message:
Specify the default floating IP pool in nova.conf

For now no default floating IP pool is specified in nova.conf
when Neutron is deployed. This causes some problems. For example,
when executing the command `nova floating-ip-create` we will have
the following error:

ERROR (NotFound): Floating ip pool not found. (HTTP 404)

This issue happens only if floating IP pool is not provided to
the command. The workaround is to provide pool to the command
as an argument, but it is convenient to have the default pool
and execute commands without extra arguments.

Closes-Bug: #1370448

Change-Id: I2c0f8659ed7c0afd925e2d468fa6019b1083e4a8

subject: Fix describing images with bdm.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-15 21:03:05.000000000', 'files': ['ec2api/api/image.py', 'ec2api/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'ec2api/tests/unit/fakes.py'], 'message': 'Fix describing images with bdm.

Image with bdm has properties like '[{"key": null}]'
that can't be parsde by ast library. Using json library
insted.
Also json lib is faster than ast by this article -
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9949533/python-eval-vs-ast-literal-eval-vs-json-decode

Change-Id: I0ae188233a44a2471afff2a6f8a4c6f9f043bfda
'}]
commit_message:
Fix describing images with bdm.

Image with bdm has properties like '[{"key": null}]'
that can't be parsde by ast library. Using json library
insted.
Also json lib is faster than ast by this article -
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9949533/python-eval-vs-ast-literal-eval-vs-json-decode

commit_message:
Scenario test for vpnaas: ipsec-site-connection

The test verifies that it is possible to establish a vpn
connection between two sites. And then it performs basic
connectivity test, it pings instance of site2 from instance
of site1 and vice versa.

Change-Id: Id0edfda58d6cb163c60a62802a2e852ca211f0fe

subject: mirror/ubuntu: make the deb package download easier to debug
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 8789, 'name': 'Dmitry Pyzhov', 'email': 'dpyzhov+gerrit@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dpyzhov'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9582, 'name': 'Dmitry Burmistrov', 'email': 'burmistrovda@gmail.com', 'username': 'dburmistrov'}, {'_account_id': 10474, 'name': 'Vitaly Parakhin', 'email': 'vparakhin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'brain461'}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-02-06 13:28:09.000000000', 'files': ['mirror/ubuntu/files/mkrepo.sh', 'mirror/ubuntu/createchroot.mk'], 'message': "mirror/ubuntu: make the deb package download easier to debug

At the moment debugging package download issues (finding out why certain
package is missing or has the dependency problems, etc) involves a lot of
guesswork sinse the temporary chroot gets removed. Apparently the only for
removing is that the directory holding the chroot gets copied to the ISO.
Create the chroot in the `build' directory rather than in local_mirror so
that removing the chroot is not mandatory any more.

* createchroot.mk:
 - introduce CHROOT_DIR (per target) variable and make chroot there,
   put CHROOT_DIR into BUILD_DIR.
 - copy only useful files (pool, dists, indices) to the local_mirror
 - don't remove the chroot, it might be very useful for debugging.

* mkrepo.sh: store APT configs/state in a different directory in order
  to not pollute the ISO with temporary files

blueprint support-ubuntu-trusty

Change-Id: Ia10f82dc79933e41a489b6e4f5d5523ce3c50d9a
"}]
commit_message:
mirror/ubuntu: make the deb package download easier to debug

At the moment debugging package download issues (finding out why certain
package is missing or has the dependency problems, etc) involves a lot of
guesswork sinse the temporary chroot gets removed. Apparently the only for
removing is that the directory holding the chroot gets copied to the ISO.
Create the chroot in the `build' directory rather than in local_mirror so
that removing the chroot is not mandatory any more.

* createchroot.mk:
 - introduce CHROOT_DIR (per target) variable and make chroot there,
   put CHROOT_DIR into BUILD_DIR.
 - copy only useful files (pool, dists, indices) to the local_mirror
 - don't remove the chroot, it might be very useful for debugging.

* mkrepo.sh: store APT configs/state in a different directory in order
  to not pollute the ISO with temporary files

blueprint support-ubuntu-trusty

Change-Id: Ia10f82dc79933e41a489b6e4f5d5523ce3c50d9a

commit_message:
Add conditional skips for nova jobs

THis change uses skip-if to avoid running
{devstack,grenade-tempest}-dsvm jobs when the files in the patchset are
deemed to not influence their execution.

Another skip-if filter avoids running non-doc jobs against doc-only nova
changes.

Based on: I638ac2d35c33eef02e2c6872ea3bd4a3d644da58

Change-Id: Id3ccf3affdcbfc2da4571557957f6f3c284fdcee

subject: Adds ability to override service name for service catalog
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-02-10 02:00:17.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/cinder_keystone_auth_spec.rb', 'manifests/keystone/auth.pp'], 'message': "Adds ability to override service name for service catalog

Instead of forcing the name of the service in the service catalog to
match auth_name, this allows the ability to explicitly set the service
name, spearately from auth_name.
If service_name is not specified, it's value defaults to the value
of auth_name (which maintains the current behavior.)

Change-Id: Ia3d00186a422a16ec6bd7b65008ec56abc1e8f67
Closes-bug: #1359755
"}]
commit_message:
Adds ability to override service name for service catalog

Instead of forcing the name of the service in the service catalog to
match auth_name, this allows the ability to explicitly set the service
name, spearately from auth_name.
If service_name is not specified, it's value defaults to the value
of auth_name (which maintains the current behavior.)

Change-Id: Ia3d00186a422a16ec6bd7b65008ec56abc1e8f67
Closes-bug: #1359755

commit_message:
Fixup Juno mysql configuration

The config parameter has changed from storage:sqlalchemy/database_conection to just
storage:sqlalchemy/connection.

The dbinit command no longer exists, and the db sync command has been
renamed.

Change-Id: I69f529717de04ee0084188a7f94dab26bc120e2f

commit_message:
Make all package name and ensure customizable

This makes all package names and package ensure values customizable as
parameters.  This is helpful for people who are not using vendor
provided packaging.  This also normalizes the package ensure value to be
'present' in all case.

Change-Id: Iee186f753b2800e59addd3f38591675fd5af35ad

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-01-20 16:58:52.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/fuel_agent/manager.py', 'fuel_agent/fuel_agent/tests/test_manager.py'], 'message': "Remove extra fs making in fuel-agent

Currently, we create FS wherever they are set even if we then put an
image on that device (image is to contain a valid FS).

Change-Id: Id45e35d18ec48b308aec2415c65de8137b745e84
Closes-Bug: #1412759

commit_message:
Remove extra fs making in fuel-agent

Currently, we create FS wherever they are set even if we then put an
image on that device (image is to contain a valid FS).
Moreover, It can consume significant amount of time. Let's avoid that.

Change-Id: Id45e35d18ec48b308aec2415c65de8137b745e84
Closes-Bug: #1412759

subject: Implement local scripts for all gate tests
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-14 17:55:22.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-tempest.sh', 'etc/rpc_deploy/rpc_user_config.yml', 'rpc_deployment/roles/neutron_common/tasks/main.yml', 'scripts/gate-check-commit.sh', 'scripts/os-ansible-aio-check.sh', 'scripts/rpc9.0.0-aio-heat-template.yml', 'scripts/run-aio-build.sh', 'scripts/labdelete.sh', 'scripts/rpc9.0.0-aio-rax-heat-template.yml', 'rpc_deployment/roles/neutron_common/files/post-up-checksum-rules.sh', 'scripts/gate-check-lint.sh', 'etc/network/interfaces.d/aio_interfaces.cfg', 'scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh', 'scripts/run-playbooks.sh', 'scripts/scripts-library.sh', 'scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh', 'etc/rpc_deploy/conf.d/swift.yml.example', 'scripts/cloudserver-aio.sh'], 'message': "Implement local scripts for all gate tests

This patch implements the following:
 - scripts-library.sh which includes commonly used functions, variables
   and other preparation commands for all other scripts
 - bootstrap-ansible.sh which only deploys a selected version of ansible
   and ensures that any other requirements are prepared on the
   deployment host
 - bootstrap-aio.sh which runs all host preparation actions for an
   all-in-one build
 - gate-check-lint.sh which runs a lint and syntax check
 - gate-check-commit.sh which runs all actions required for a gate
   commit check, utilising the other scripts where required
 - run-smoke-test.sh which runs tempest from inside the utility container
 - run-playbooks.sh which runs the playbooks
 - the existing conf.d/swift.yml is renamed to be an example
   configuration - the example configurations can be used as
   documentation
 - etc/network/interfaces.d/aio_interfaces.cfg,
   etc/rpc_deploy/conf.d/swift.yml and
   etc/rpc_deploy/rpc_user_config.yml are now configurations used for
   the AIO deployment
 - a workaround for https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1244589 to ensure
   that DHCP checksums are implemented by the host which is required for
   the smoke tests to work
 - the removal of the rpc heat templates as they're unusable in their
   current state
 - setting MAX_RETRIES to 0, ensuring that any failures cause an
   immediate commit check failure in the gate - this prevents the
   masking of failures by retry attempts

Conflicts:
        etc/rpc_deploy/conf.d/swift.yml
        etc/rpc_deploy/rpc_user_config.yml
        scripts/os-ansible-aio-check.sh
        scripts/rpc9.0.0-aio-heat-template.yml
        scripts/rpc9.0.0-aio-rax-heat-template.yml
        scripts/run-aio-build.sh

Closes-Bug: #1415883
Closes-Bug: #1417999
Closes-Bug: #1419807
Change-Id: I95242d48ad0fb055f16510803c8aa14dc183ac17
(cherry picked from commit 6b12bf366369d7b1d0f5bdfbc8afc05f447363fb)
"}]
commit_message:
Implement local scripts for all gate tests

This patch implements the following:
 - scripts-library.sh which includes commonly used functions, variables
   and other preparation commands for all other scripts
 - bootstrap-ansible.sh which only deploys a selected version of ansible
   and ensures that any other requirements are prepared on the
   deployment host
 - bootstrap-aio.sh which runs all host preparation actions for an
   all-in-one build
 - gate-check-lint.sh which runs a lint and syntax check
 - gate-check-commit.sh which runs all actions required for a gate
   commit check, utilising the other scripts where required
 - run-smoke-test.sh which runs tempest from inside the utility container
 - run-playbooks.sh which runs the playbooks
 - the existing conf.d/swift.yml is renamed to be an example
   configuration - the example configurations can be used as
   documentation
 - etc/network/interfaces.d/aio_interfaces.cfg,
   etc/rpc_deploy/conf.d/swift.yml and
   etc/rpc_deploy/rpc_user_config.yml are now configurations used for
   the AIO deployment
 - a workaround for https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1244589 to ensure
   that DHCP checksums are implemented by the host which is required for
   the smoke tests to work
 - the removal of the rpc heat templates as they're unusable in their
   current state
 - setting MAX_RETRIES to 0, ensuring that any failures cause an
   immediate commit check failure in the gate - this prevents the
   masking of failures by retry attempts

Conflicts:
        etc/rpc_deploy/conf.d/swift.yml
        etc/rpc_deploy/rpc_user_config.yml
        scripts/os-ansible-aio-check.sh
        scripts/rpc9.0.0-aio-heat-template.yml
        scripts/rpc9.0.0-aio-rax-heat-template.yml
        scripts/run-aio-build.sh

DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
Closes-Bug: #1415883
Closes-Bug: #1417999
Closes-Bug: #1419807
Change-Id: I95242d48ad0fb055f16510803c8aa14dc183ac17
(cherry picked from commit 6b12bf366369d7b1d0f5bdfbc8afc05f447363fb)

commit_message:
Use pool's capabilities for flavors in v2

Instead of allowing users to set their own capabilites, use the
capabilities already provided by the pool itself. These capabilities are
loaded from the the stores themselves based on the pool's configuration.

Partially-Implements blueprint: expose-storage-capabilities

Change-Id: Ib3b8c062035ef7255ad670093d28dbf491505c31

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-11 14:07:10.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cluster/manifests/haproxy.pp'], 'message': 'Let HAProxy determine usefulness of TCP splicing

The "splice-auto" options causes HAProxy to evaluate splice() system
call performance using light heuristic, independently for requests and
responses. The possible gain of splicing depends on too many factors and
might be dependent on used hardware so there is no point in hardcoding
it.

Change-Id: I06e106eaacf9c67a9ef1582a37b5c46209fb0c2b
Closes-Bug: 1420710
'}]
commit_message:
Let HAProxy determine usefulness of TCP splicing

The "splice-auto" options causes HAProxy to evaluate splice() system
call performance using light heuristic, independently for requests and
responses. The possible gain of splicing depends on too many factors and
might be dependent on used hardware so there is no point in hardcoding
it.

Change-Id: I06e106eaacf9c67a9ef1582a37b5c46209fb0c2b
Closes-Bug: 1420710

commit_message:
Use cls instead of self in classmethod

`set_network_resources` is a class method, but it uses "self" instead of
"cls", which works but is very confusing. Fixing that.

Change-Id: I2d884d43c3d8f81f25fb1ea670948b4a6ff43a88

commit_message:
Enable teardown_unused_network_gateway for nova-network deployments

The parameter is used by nova-network to determine if a bridge and
gateway IP address of a network must be deleted from the compute node
when the network is deleted in API. By default, it is set to 'False'
which means that bridge, IP address and dnsmasq process listening on
that address are left behind even after the network is deleted.

Change-Id: I4c94bb03501f4238ead2378cf504485b7d67b236
Closes-Bug: 1401870

commit_message:

Detailed information in log will be more useful and readable for
debugging, rather than just print the object's address.

FWIW, see the unmeaningful log below:
DEBUG mistral.engine1.commands [-] Running workflow task:
<mistral.workbook.v2.tasks.TaskSpec object at 0x4a06710>

Change-Id: I087621554f67d29b8b0aadabd0f432ced9ab0d8d

commit_message:
Split MongoDB's default implementation from FIFO's

The patch adds support for both FIFO and non-FIFO mongodb
implementations. It takes advantage of the `uri` scheme to determine
whether the FIFO implementation is needed or not.

A follow-up patch will improve this driver loading phase to match what's
been stated in the spec.

DocImpact
Partially-Implements blueprint: expose-storage-capabilities

Change-Id: Ic25e1893d0bab640ac038097ed89e5b699d5490a

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'JiÅÃ­ StrÃ¡nskÃ½', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-13 03:19:30.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml', 'controller-post.yaml', 'overcloud-resource-registry.yaml', 'overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml', 'puppet/controller-puppet.yaml', 'puppet/controller-post-puppet.yaml'], 'message': "Controller: Exec puppet after all configuration

This patch adds a new ControllerNodesPostDeployment resource
which can be used along with the environment file to
specify a nested stack which is guaranteed to execute
after all the Controller config (HA, or other) have
executed.

This is really useful for Puppet in that Heat actually
controls where puppet executes in the deployment
process and we want to ensure puppet runs after
all hiera configuration data has be deployed to
the nodes. With the previous approach some of the
data would be there, but most of the HA data which
actually gets composed outside of the controller-puppet.yaml
nested stack would not be guaranteed to be there in time.

As os-apply-config (tripleo-image-elements) have their
ordering controlled within the elements themselves an empty stubbed
in nested stack has been added so that we don't break that
implementation.

Partial-bug: 1418805

Change-Id: Icd6b2c9c1f9b057c28649ee3bdce0039f3fd8422
"}]
commit_message:
Controller: Exec puppet after all configuration

This patch adds a new ControllerNodesPostDeployment resource
which can be used along with the environment file to
specify a nested stack which is guaranteed to execute
after all the Controller config (HA, or other) have
executed.

This is really useful for Puppet in that Heat actually
controls where puppet executes in the deployment
process and we want to ensure puppet runs after
all hiera configuration data has be deployed to
the nodes. With the previous approach some of the
data would be there, but most of the HA data which
actually gets composed outside of the controller-puppet.yaml
nested stack would not be guaranteed to be there in time.

As os-apply-config (tripleo-image-elements) have their
ordering controlled within the elements themselves an empty stubbed
in nested stack has been added so that we don't break that
implementation.

Partial-bug: 1418805

Change-Id: Icd6b2c9c1f9b057c28649ee3bdce0039f3fd8422

commit_message:
Set bind host for keystone on container start

Bind host in keystone during docker run is now set
to localhost only so it is less likely to report
keystone as ready before it actually is.

Change-Id: I25fe00b822982b001601d1a5c70824f00f8cad1c
Partial-Bug: #1401477

commit_message:
Fix the AUTH URL v2 to v3 conversion

The current approach to transform the v2 auth url into a v3 one
only works if there is no trailing slash.
Using dirname handles both cases.

Change-Id: Ib3d46ece28b3ee7929da865ac2fa5426046abb05

commit_message:
Tasks hang bug in nailgun cluster perf test fixed

The manner in which test_rerun_stopped_deploy was decorated was wrong.
It used fake_tasks argument combination that didn't suit tests
integration nature (the tasks were mocked as successful, but were
created with errors). Moreover roles for nodes in test cluster were
improperly inserted.

Change-Id: I25cf9fd594b7885225faac45245d0bec309be808
Closes-Bug: #1419046

commit_message:
Automatically expand the current panel group on dashboard expansion

If the panel is active, then collapse the panelgroup and
collapse the dashboard, the panelgroup with active panel
can not expand while expanding the dashboard which collapsed
just now.

Steps to reproduce:

1. login as admin
2. click 'Project Dashboard',it default expand 'Compute' panel.
3. click 'Network' panel header,then click 'Router'
4. click 'Network' panel header again(collapse the Network panel)
5. click 'Project Dashboard'(collapse the Project panel)
6. click 'Project Dashboard'(expand the Project panel)

After those steps we can see the 'Network' panelgroup can not
expand Automatically, the patch fix it.

Change-Id: I3b4d86c4f7ae42da241d021c746dbe3b8564a4c4
Closes-Bug: 1405681
(cherry picked from commit a2d56e8876b42b05688fedd93b1853720731fcf3)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-11 12:47:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: fix emulator thread pinning when doing strict CPU pinning

When guest vCPUs are confined to particular set of host pCPUs, the
emulator threads from QEMU are intended to be pinned to the union
of the host pCPUs that the vCPUs are associated with.

The code in Nova was in fact confining the emulator threads to the
union of pCPUs in the host NUMA nodes that the guest was confined
to. When running guests in NUMA mode with shared CPUs / overcommit
this was functionally identical, but when running guests with
dedicated CPUs this was incorrect.

The (incorrect) libvirt config being generated was

  <cputune>
      <shares>4096</shares>
      <vcpupin vcpu='0' cpuset='0'/>
      <vcpupin vcpu='1' cpuset='1'/>
      <vcpupin vcpu='2' cpuset='4'/>
      <vcpupin vcpu='3' cpuset='5'/>
      <emulatorpin cpuset='0-5'/>
  </cputune>

when it should have been

  <cputune>
      <shares>4096</shares>
      <vcpupin vcpu='0' cpuset='0'/>
      <vcpupin vcpu='1' cpuset='1'/>
      <vcpupin vcpu='2' cpuset='4'/>
      <vcpupin vcpu='3' cpuset='5'/>
      <emulatorpin cpuset='0-1,4-5'/>
  </cputune>

This was not caught because the unit tests were only checking with
a host numa topology that had the same number of cpus as the guest
topology. The test is changed to make the host topology massive
compared to guest topology

Closes-bug: 1417671
Change-Id: I81e0fa1d9b09ec2df2af5e21c7d95b21be435f90
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: fix emulator thread pinning when doing strict CPU pinning

When guest vCPUs are confined to particular set of host pCPUs, the
emulator threads from QEMU are intended to be pinned to the union
of the host pCPUs that the vCPUs are associated with.

The code in Nova was in fact confining the emulator threads to the
union of pCPUs in the host NUMA nodes that the guest was confined
to. When running guests in NUMA mode with shared CPUs / overcommit
this was functionally identical, but when running guests with
dedicated CPUs this was incorrect.

The (incorrect) libvirt config being generated was

  <cputune>
      <shares>4096</shares>
      <vcpupin vcpu='0' cpuset='0'/>
      <vcpupin vcpu='1' cpuset='1'/>
      <vcpupin vcpu='2' cpuset='4'/>
      <vcpupin vcpu='3' cpuset='5'/>
      <emulatorpin cpuset='0-5'/>
  </cputune>

when it should have been

  <cputune>
      <shares>4096</shares>
      <vcpupin vcpu='0' cpuset='0'/>
      <vcpupin vcpu='1' cpuset='1'/>
      <vcpupin vcpu='2' cpuset='4'/>
      <vcpupin vcpu='3' cpuset='5'/>
      <emulatorpin cpuset='0-1,4-5'/>
  </cputune>

This was not caught because the unit tests were only checking with
a host numa topology that had the same number of cpus as the guest
topology. The test is changed to make the host topology massive
compared to guest topology

Closes-bug: 1417671
Change-Id: I81e0fa1d9b09ec2df2af5e21c7d95b21be435f90

commit_message:
libvirt: rewrite NUMA topology generator to be more flexible

The current _fake_caps_numa_topology method returns a NUMA topology
with 4 cells, 1 socket per cell, 1 core per socket & 2 threads per
core.

Rewrite the method to it can generate topologies with arbitrary
values for cells, sockets, cores & threads.

Related-bug: 1417671
Change-Id: I94d5b1eeb34d6681683996a5d01033f12eb7c5b8

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-11 12:47:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: Fix logically inconsistent host NUMA topology

The _fake_caps_numa_topology() sets up a fake host NUMA topology
that the tests will use. The definition it has setup though is
logically inconsistent. The setup as 4 nodes with 2 CPUs in each
cell, but it then says there are 2 cores per socket and 2 thread
siblings per core. This implies 4 CPUs per cell, not 2. Either
the topology should have 2 cores with 1 thread, or 1 core with
2 threads. The test cases using this topology are written to
treat it as meaning 1 core with 2 threads, so fix it according
to this interpretation

Related-bug: 1417671
Change-Id: I9d7928a6f9b15f8eb29ef92606e6ca1d2b688a6e
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Fix logically inconsistent host NUMA topology

The _fake_caps_numa_topology() sets up a fake host NUMA topology
that the tests will use. The definition it has setup though is
logically inconsistent. The setup as 4 nodes with 2 CPUs in each
cell, but it then says there are 2 cores per socket and 2 thread
siblings per core. This implies 4 CPUs per cell, not 2. Either
the topology should have 2 cores with 1 thread, or 1 core with
2 threads. The test cases using this topology are written to
treat it as meaning 1 core with 2 threads, so fix it according
to this interpretation

Related-bug: 1417671
Change-Id: I9d7928a6f9b15f8eb29ef92606e6ca1d2b688a6e

commit_message:
Fix the topology page for deeply nested environments

* Build links between nodes in 2 passes. This allows to connect not
  only the top-level nodes, but all the nodes nested deeper inside.
* Draw arrows on the links and direct them in the opposite direction
* Distinguish between aggregation links (solid) and reference links
  (dashed ones).

Change-Id: I2db160793ded874c588e1edbef769361fd26cecc

prevent the logs fill the disk on the controller node.

commit_message:
Improving jshint

- Including JS files under horizon/static/angular/ folder.
- Adding .jshintrc to allow globals defined by jQuery, Angular,
  Angular mock, Jasmine, d3 and jsi18n.
- Allowing global strict mode in spec files.

commit_message:
Adding instance name to boot command example

The required parameter instance name was not included in the
example code for booting with user data or showing file injection.
Both lines were modified to include the instance name.

Change-Id: I327edec8271e269b7682b80c18b57c22416e6cb4
Closes-Bug: #1421292

subject: Bypass type conversion when setting default prop
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-14 06:00:23.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/resource.py', 'openstack/tests/test_resource.py'], 'message': "Bypass type conversion when setting default prop

When a prop has a type, if the default value is ever put through
__set__, we'll try to convert that default value into type. For example,
as is currently happening in network.v2.router, the REST API returns
null (None) when no gateway information is set, but when it is set, it
returns a dictionary. Trying to put that default None value through to
set the value causes a TypeError.

If we're given the default value to set on a property, just
short-circuit and return out of __set__. We already have the default
and we know how to return the default value.

The reason we don't go through and set this default value into
instance._attrs is that it puts us through type conversion on the
__get__ end of it. Actually setting this default value is that true
internal attribute value will then raise a TypeError during the
attribute access.

Change-Id: I106c9c54f57596cb2e12e8bbb5cd380867be876b
"}]
commit_message:
Bypass type conversion when setting default prop

When a prop has a type, if the default value is ever put through
__set__, we'll try to convert that default value into type. For example,
as is currently happening in network.v2.router, the REST API returns
null (None) when no gateway information is set, but when it is set, it
returns a dictionary. Trying to put that default None value through to
set the value causes a TypeError.

If we're given the default value to set on a property, just
short-circuit and return out of __set__. We already have the default
and we know how to return the default value.

The reason we don't go through and set this default value into
instance._attrs is that it puts us through type conversion on the
__get__ end of it. Actually setting this default value is that true
internal attribute value will then raise a TypeError during the
attribute access.

Change-Id: I106c9c54f57596cb2e12e8bbb5cd380867be876b

commit_message:
document snapshot auto-delete

Adding to the api docs to note that stack snapshots will be
auto-deleted upon stack deletion and that only active stacks
can be restored.  Deleted stacks must be recreated.

Change-Id: I3cb55846f7215d326ea10071e133a4776dc52be5
Closes-Bug: 1413298

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-11 23:40:49.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/heat.yaml'], 'message': 'check-heat-dsvm-functional-mysql raise timeout

The median run for check-heat-dsvm-functional-mysql just under
60 minutes, and some runs are now failing due to hitting the

commit_message:
check-heat-dsvm-functional-mysql raise timeout

The median run for check-heat-dsvm-functional-mysql just under
60 minutes, and some runs are now failing due to hitting the
65 minute timeout. Run times have been increasing steadily
as tests are added.

This change raises the timeout to 125 minutes.

Change-Id: I85c21002db45547463c24cb896e2414006a1d97e

This repo will be used for development of Neutron NEC plugins/drivers.

networking-nec-ci will be used to allow NEC CI to post CI results.

commit_message:
Add networking-nec project to StackForge

This repo will be used for development of Neutron NEC plugins/drivers.

The need of setting this repo up is inline with spec proposal
of Neutron core-vendor-decomposition [1].

networking-nec-ci will be used to allow NEC CI to post CI results.

commit_message:
Add version specific test cases for microverison

in nova api-microversion spec, we mentioned we might support
version specific test cases (see below example)
So some test cases should be added.

This patch adds test cases for the version specific test cases.

@api_version(min_version='2.1')
def _version_specific_func(self, req, arg1):
    pass

@api_version(min_version='2.5')
def _version_specific_func(self, req, arg1):
    pass

def show(self, req, id):
    .... common stuff ....
    self._version_specific_func(req, "foo")
    .... common stuff ....

Partially implements blueprint api-microversions

Change-Id: I27def1020ad6c948922cdaabf86cca4e4ca90f7c

[{'number': 45, 'created': '2015-02-13 20:19:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: fix overly strict CPU model comparison in live migration

The current libvirt driver migration code checks whether the
dest host can support the guest, by comparing the source host
CPU model. This is overly strict, as the guest may well be
running with a more restrictive CPU model that hides many
host features.  The correct approach is to compare against
the guest's configured CPU model.

To achieve the compatibility when migrate instance from old compute
node which does not provide vcpu_model in instance object, the source
host's compute info is still provided.

Co-authored: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
Co-authored: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

Closes-Bug: 1082414

Change-Id: I65f505fec64c65d2641d2bfd940cde44bcd83a78
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: fix overly strict CPU model comparison in live migration

The current libvirt driver migration code checks whether the
dest host can support the guest, by comparing the source host
CPU model. This is overly strict, as the guest may well be
running with a more restrictive CPU model that hides many
host features.  The correct approach is to compare against
the guest's configured CPU model.

To achieve the compatibility when migrate instance from old compute
node which does not provide vcpu_model in instance object, the source
host's compute info is still provided.

Co-authored: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
Co-authored: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

Closes-Bug: 1082414

Change-Id: I65f505fec64c65d2641d2bfd940cde44bcd83a78

Utilize the virt_cpu_model in libvirt for guest cpu config.

Currently we try to update the instance's cpu config each time we
recreated the xml, which means if there are some host configuration changes,
the changes will be applied to the instance as well.

This is same as current implementation, but we may need some enhancement

Implements: blueprint resource-objects
Change-Id: I95f52ed2dc37d6d261a9a8ebcb59aa53c3c32f65
"}]
commit_message:
Libvirt: vcpu_model support

Utilize the virt_cpu_model in libvirt for guest cpu config.

Currently we try to update the instance's cpu config each time we
recreated the xml, which means if there are some host configuration changes,
the changes will be applied to the instance as well.

This is same as current implementation, but we may need some enhancement
there.

Implements: blueprint resource-objects
Change-Id: I95f52ed2dc37d6d261a9a8ebcb59aa53c3c32f65

commit_message:
NetApp fix vol migration unusability

This patch fixes the volume migration related issue
in which the volume became unusable after successfull inbound
migration due to volume id usage instead of name_id.

Closes-bug: #1370098

Change-Id: Iacb14ea07890859b5cf8a27c150aa5f6e8a98777
(cherry picked from commit c61577773c6da7dbe9d21c9f25962192119ce165)

own id. This is need for unifying physical_resource_id

other services.

Change Nova::FloatingIPAssociation resource's id

to resource's own id. This is need for unifying physical
resource id format for simplify potential resource id
handling by other services.

Apply neutron network constraint

resources.

network constraint to make sure it works if user using
nova_network.

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-12-18 01:57:16.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/exception.py'], 'message': "Neutron: Check port binding status

Neutron api creates/uses a port which the port vif_type is
'binding_failed' without any verification, this leads libvirt
driver failed to create instance, and cause vif driver raise
a wrong exception message when binding failed.

this patch addes a new exception PortBindingFailed to indicats
the port binding failed.

Closes-Bug: 1390336
Co-authored-by: Alex Xu <xuhj@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I741848e4ec3738045fb17da738f144373a9bb72d
"}]
commit_message:
Neutron: Check port binding status

Neutron api creates/uses a port which the port vif_type is
'binding_failed' without any verification, this leads libvirt
driver failed to create instance, and cause vif driver raise
a wrong exception message when binding failed.

this patch addes a new exception PortBindingFailed to indicats
the port binding failed.

Closes-Bug: 1390336
Co-authored-by: Alex Xu <xuhj@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I741848e4ec3738045fb17da738f144373a9bb72d

commit_message:
Set maas_cdm play user to "root"

The maas_cdm play will fail if not run as root and the set user can't
access the remote hosts. This patch brings the maas_cdm play in line
with the other maas plays.

Change-Id: Ib42e0ac4bfa81e2c54c5eb7e2d60664048f5b067
Closes-Bug: #1420735

commit_message:
Default maas_filesystem_threshold

The maas_cdm play will fail if maas_filesystem_threshold is not
specified. This patch defaults the value to 90.0 so that the play will
still work if this variable isn't specified in user_variables.yml.

Change-Id: Ic429c10e005c4717c3efc3b2714c6449db2aa64b
Closes-Bug: #1420729

subject: Retry installing apt packages by default
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-12 17:01:43.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/roles/galera_common/tasks/main.yml', 'rpc_deployment/roles/logging_common/tasks/main.yml', 'rpc_deployment/roles/container_common/tasks/container_packages.yml', 'rpc_deployment/roles/host_common/tasks/sysstat.yml', 'rpc_deployment/roles/lxc_common/tasks/lxc_install.yml', 'rpc_deployment/roles/common/tasks/repos.yml', 'rpc_deployment/roles/common/tasks/utils.yml', 'rpc_deployment/roles/haproxy_common/tasks/main.yml', 'rpc_deployment/roles/safe_upgrade/tasks/main.yml', 'rpc_deployment/roles/rabbit_common/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': 'Retry installing apt packages by default

There are a number of tasks used to install apt packages. Some of the
tasks will retry on failure and others will not. These tasks are
susceptible to failure and so it makes sense that they retry if the
task fails.

This commit updates the apt tasks so that they all retry with the
default retries and delay values of 3 and 5 respectively. In addition
all the tasks will attempt to update the cache if it is older than
600 seconds.

Some of the apt tasks had the state set to latest, this has been
changed to present because upgrades should be handled by specific
upgrade tasks.

Closes-Bug: #1421238
Change-Id: I8c20c5c0a2ce87706a99734adcdf55c93efb405c
'}]
commit_message:
Retry installing apt packages by default

There are a number of tasks used to install apt packages. Some of the
tasks will retry on failure and others will not. These tasks are
susceptible to failure and so it makes sense that they retry if the
task fails.

This commit updates the apt tasks so that they all retry with the
default retries and delay values of 3 and 5 respectively. In addition
all the tasks will attempt to update the cache if it is older than
600 seconds.

Some of the apt tasks had the state set to latest, this has been
changed to present because upgrades should be handled by specific
upgrade tasks.

Closes-Bug: #1421238
Change-Id: I8c20c5c0a2ce87706a99734adcdf55c93efb405c

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-05 10:31:36.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/approved/api-microversions.rst'], 'message': 'Change microversion header name

Ironic has already implemented its own microversion mechanism, and
the header name is X-Ironic-API-Version, not X-Baremetal-API-Version.
Because Ida9f60d8cbd0dcf48669b82e619fc4016ee0bcb7 removed program
terminology from the governance repo.
The microversions of Nova is not used yet. And for consistency of
whole OpenStack projects, this patch changes microversion header
names on Nova side.

Partially implements blueprint api-microversions

Change-Id: I1b43e2662107ad81e57b96f0c9430c61b795fdea
'}]
commit_message:
Change microversion header name

Ironic has already implemented its own microversion mechanism, and
the header name is X-Ironic-API-Version, not X-Baremetal-API-Version.
Because Ida9f60d8cbd0dcf48669b82e619fc4016ee0bcb7 removed program
terminology from the governance repo.
The microversions of Nova is not used yet. And for consistency of
whole OpenStack projects, this patch changes microversion header
names on Nova side.

Partially implements blueprint api-microversions

Change-Id: I1b43e2662107ad81e57b96f0c9430c61b795fdea

subject: Disable nova policy_dirs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-13 22:45:29.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova'], 'message': "Disable nova policy_dirs

Since we aren't using policy_dirs in nova don't use the default value of
the directory 'policy.d' since oslo will log a warning every time a
policy is being checked, which is a lot.

In a single run we see the following log over 9000 times:
  Can not find policy directory: policy.d

Change-Id: I68880f1ad37b0dd26690331d090884f6322afc85
Related-Bug:# 1421863
"}]
commit_message:
Disable nova policy_dirs

Since we aren't using policy_dirs in nova don't use the default value of
the directory 'policy.d' since oslo will log a warning every time a
policy is being checked, which is a lot.

In a single run we see the following log over 9000 times:
  Can not find policy directory: policy.d

Change-Id: I68880f1ad37b0dd26690331d090884f6322afc85
Related-Bug:# 1421863

commit_message:
EMC VNX Cinder Driver iSCSI multipath enhancement

This commit is to be consistent with the iSCSI multipath
ehancement in Cinder and Nova:
* Return multiple portals and iqns when multipath=True is
  specified in the connector info
* Return one portal and iqn when multipath=False is specified
  in the connector info

Change-Id: I47376ad6ac38e84569d92d62d3d8daa1359d797d
Implements: blueprint emc-vnx-driver-iscsi-multipath-enhancement

subject: Do not call get_json() in TestPost
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-16 01:59:19.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/api/controllers/v1/test_node.py', 'magnum/tests/api/controllers/v1/test_bay.py', 'magnum/tests/api/controllers/v1/test_baymodel.py', 'magnum/tests/api/controllers/v1/test_replicationcontroller.py', 'magnum/tests/api/controllers/v1/test_service.py'], 'message': 'Do not call get_json() in TestPost

Currently for the test cases in TestPost, it always call post_json
first then get_json to get detail for objects, but actually, there is
already object info in the return value for post_json.

This patch is removing get_json for those cases and use values
returned by post_json directly.

The objects covered in this patch include:
1) bay
2) baymodel
3) node
4) service
5) replication controller

Implements part of bp increase-test-coverage

Change-Id: Ieb7887e9a93860fb8888e5a6d9ff776003fc878a
'}]
commit_message:
Do not call get_json() in TestPost

Currently for the test cases in TestPost, it always call post_json
first then get_json to get detail for objects, but actually, there is
already object info in the return value for post_json.

This patch is removing get_json for those cases and use values
returned by post_json directly.

The objects covered in this patch include:
1) bay
2) baymodel
3) node
4) service
5) replication controller

Implements part of bp increase-test-coverage

Change-Id: Ieb7887e9a93860fb8888e5a6d9ff776003fc878a

This patch checkes if the specified host can satisfy the rebuiled
instances's specify requirement, such as flavor's extra metadata.

it will prevent to evacuate/rebuild an instance to a host which can not

Closes-bug: 1409613
Change-Id: I99ca0507600d77c00bc718046d89fd9639803796

commit_message:
Check if host can satisfy instance's requirement when rebuild

This patch checkes if the specified host can satisfy the rebuiled
instances's specify requirement, such as flavor's extra metadata.

it will prevent to evacuate/rebuild an instance to a host which can not
satisfy the instance's requirement.

Closes-bug: 1409613
Change-Id: I99ca0507600d77c00bc718046d89fd9639803796

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-16 05:27:27.000000000', 'files': ['troveclient/client.py', 'troveclient/v1/client.py'], 'message': 'Pass all kwargs through to adapter

Part of the benefit of clients using the keystoneclient adapter to
manage the session object is that we can have a standard set of kwargs
that can be controlled from the adapter. This only works if the unknown
kwargs are passed through to the adapter.

Change-Id: I78f195ef739dbfe33a08f4dc1922b14ec77ae833
'}]
commit_message:
Pass all kwargs through to adapter

Part of the benefit of clients using the keystoneclient adapter to
manage the session object is that we can have a standard set of kwargs
that can be controlled from the adapter. This only works if the unknown
kwargs are passed through to the adapter.

Change-Id: I78f195ef739dbfe33a08f4dc1922b14ec77ae833

commit_message:
Updated SSL to TLS

References to SSL have been updated to TLS
as TLS is generally recommended. Some examples
in the text are specific to SSL; these have not
been changed.

Change-Id: I40a0e935f5050d041a849bf4835adcd3c29a398f
Closes-Bug: #1343571

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-02-13 22:57:08.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar/tests/unit/storage/base.py', 'tests/unit/storage/test_pool_queues.py', 'zaqar/tests/base.py', 'zaqar/storage/errors.py', 'zaqar/storage/utils.py', 'zaqar/storage/sqlalchemy/pools.py', 'zaqar/storage/base.py', 'tests/unit/storage/test_pool_catalog.py', 'zaqar/storage/mongodb/pools.py'], 'message': "Forbid adding stores with mismatching capabilities

We're currently allow stores with mismatching capabilities to co-exist
under the same pool group. This is wrong, as it's assumed that all
stores in a pool group support the same capabilities.

Partially-Implements blueprint: expose-storage-capabilities

Change-Id: I7bc5065ab2e5d9db05a3995f97bd6c6d5b2e538f
"}]
commit_message:
Forbid adding stores with mismatching capabilities

We're currently allow stores with mismatching capabilities to co-exist
under the same pool group. This is wrong, as it's assumed that all
stores in a pool group support the same capabilities.

Partially-Implements blueprint: expose-storage-capabilities

commit_message:
Sync periodic_task module from oslo-incubator

We have a need in Cinder to now be able to dynamically
add periodic tasks.  This sync brings in new functionality
that supports that.

Current HEAD in OSLO:
---------------------
commit 03143669d2c996f7c20d2d75f6c67827d2db216a
Date:   Tue Feb 10 11:59:45 2015 -0500
Update policy.py status in MAINTAINERS

Changes merged with this patch:
---------------------
2aacb111 Change oslo.config to oslo_config
2fbf5065 Remove oslo.log code and clean up versionutils API
fbd77a7b Allow overriding name for periodic tasks
9896e0e1 Separate add_periodic_task from the metaclass __init__

Change-Id: If39ce7baddd6ad5325afcd504bab8ac305da939d

Since provided values are not meant to change (and
this statement is useless) we should not try to
perform an update() on the provided values (the update
is a no-op anyway, so might as well get rid of it).

Change-Id: I18699fc64391445436537854a5e3723f4e89e961
'}]
commit_message:
Provided requirements are meant to be immutable

Since provided values are not meant to change (and
this statement is useless) we should not try to
perform an update() on the provided values (the update
is a no-op anyway, so might as well get rid of it).

Change-Id: I18699fc64391445436537854a5e3723f4e89e961

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-10 11:25:31.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/v2/client.py'], 'message': 'Fix volume_transfers import in v2

Fixing the import of volume_transfers in v2 client.
It was importing volume_transfers from v1.
Even though at this moment the imported files are identical, in the
future volume_transfers in v2 may change, and v2 client should use the
v2 volume_transfers.
Since the intent is for v1 to be deprecated in the future, we must be
careful with these little details.

Closes-Bug: #1420238

Change-Id: I41c385de32ccf66d23002a8e369848016fa2c790
'}]
commit_message:
Fix volume_transfers import in v2

Fixing the import of volume_transfers in v2 client.
It was importing volume_transfers from v1.
Even though at this moment the imported files are identical, in the
future volume_transfers in v2 may change, and v2 client should use the
v2 volume_transfers.
Since the intent is for v1 to be deprecated in the future, we must be
careful with these little details.

Closes-Bug: #1420238

Change-Id: I41c385de32ccf66d23002a8e369848016fa2c790

commit_message:
Scality: Lock around SOFS mount to avoid a race

Both cinder-volume and cinder-backup could want to mount the
SOFS at the same time (during init).

Backported is needed because this bug is quite severe. When system boots
cinder-backup and cinder-volume are likely to start at the same time.

Related-Bug: #1410341
Change-Id: I75faa6eb283bc7c1f655cf5b051bed025af3d701
(cherry picked from commit 4b136f574f465ce0fdd67299f5ed5f912bf5598b)

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-12 11:11:35.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_srb.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/srb.py'], 'message': "Fix Scality SRB driver security concerns

LP #1414531 raised 2 issues :
1)A potential arbitrary code execution if the Cinder Linux user
has write access to /etc/cinder/cinder.conf
2)An overall concern/question about the usage of the command
'sudo sh -c' throughout the srb driver

This patch fixes 1) with proper configuration validation and
2) with usage of cinder-rootwrap.

Closes-Bug: 1414531
Change-Id: Idddb9633af3a45d65bbfa0146a14575e2984f6bd
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Scality SRB driver security concerns

LP #1414531 raised 2 issues :
1)A potential arbitrary code execution if the Cinder Linux user
has write access to /etc/cinder/cinder.conf
2)An overall concern/question about the usage of the command
'sudo sh -c' throughout the srb driver

This patch fixes 1) with proper configuration validation and
2) with usage of cinder-rootwrap.

Closes-Bug: 1414531
Change-Id: Idddb9633af3a45d65bbfa0146a14575e2984f6bd

Use ABCmeta classes to define feature sets of drivers.
As interim solution the VolumeDriver class stays mainly unchanged to
ensure that all drivers work and can be migrated stepwise by the
driver maintainer.

Co-Authored-By: Mike Perez <thingee@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Split volume driver into ABC classes

Use ABCmeta classes to define feature sets of drivers.
As interim solution the VolumeDriver class stays mainly unchanged to
ensure that all drivers work and can be migrated stepwise by the
driver maintainer.

Co-Authored-By: Mike Perez <thingee@gmail.com>
Implements: blueprint abc-volume-drivers
Change-Id: I558ded19368aaa7ce4be029fa16f63e6e188097a

This patch fixes inconsistencies between Project > Images > Create Image
and its Admin equivalent by applying the same JS to both. Specifically,
it fixes missing asterisks and file format detection.

Change-Id: I84f98dfcff6cd38161e23bbb60c3b4b8419240f8
Closes-Bug: 1393727

commit_message:
Applies ImageFormCtrl to Admin > Images

This patch fixes inconsistencies between Project > Images > Create Image
and its Admin equivalent by applying the same JS to both. Specifically,
it fixes missing asterisks and file format detection.

Change-Id: I84f98dfcff6cd38161e23bbb60c3b4b8419240f8
Closes-Bug: 1393727
Closes-Bug: 1395689

without the quotes.

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-01-15 03:10:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/fake_policy.py', 'nova/api/ec2/cloud.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/ec2/test_cloud.py', 'etc/nova/policy.d/00-ec2-api.json'], 'message': 'Add REST API policy checking for ec2 network related api

Adding follow rules for ec2 network releated api.
the policy checking will be enforced at REST layer first.

    "ec2_api:allocate_address": "",
    "ec2_api:associate_address": "rule:ec2_admin_or_owner",
    "ec2_api:describe_addresses": "rule:ec2_admin_or_owner",
    "ec2_api:disassociate_address": "rule:ec2_admin_or_owner",
    "ec2_api:release_address": "rule:ec2_admin_or_owner"

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
Change-Id: Ifc271f96578f867bcf206f14a9cbcf1f026c3cdb
'}]
commit_message:
Add REST API policy checking for ec2 network related api

Adding follow rules for ec2 network releated api.
the policy checking will be enforced at REST layer first.

    "ec2_api:allocate_address": "",
    "ec2_api:associate_address": "rule:ec2_admin_or_owner",
    "ec2_api:describe_addresses": "rule:ec2_admin_or_owner",
    "ec2_api:disassociate_address": "rule:ec2_admin_or_owner",
    "ec2_api:release_address": "rule:ec2_admin_or_owner"

Detail can be found at https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/apipolicycheck

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
Change-Id: Ifc271f96578f867bcf206f14a9cbcf1f026c3cdb

commit_message:
Add missing api samples for floating-ips api(v2)

floating-ips api missing floating-ips-get-resp sample file,
and the integrated test cases use a wrong sample file(algouth
the contents are same).

This patch addes missing api samples file and correct the
integrated test case.

Change-Id: I6e9cf14187f018dc33b34d8f7ab65af1d862f345

There's little point to extract attributes from a dict,
construct another dict, and make _process_provider_segment

subject: Fix shared firewall policy can not be displayed in horizon
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 2711, 'name': 'Zhang Hua', 'display_name': 'Zhang Hua', 'email': 'joshua.zhang@canonical.com', 'username': 'zhhuabj'}, {'_account_id': 5623, 'name': 'David Lyle', 'email': 'dklyle0@gmail.com', 'username': 'david-lyle'}, {'_account_id': 6610, 'name': 'Zhenguo Niu', 'email': 'Niu.ZGlinux@gmail.com', 'username': 'niu-zglinux'}, {'_account_id': 8992, 'name': 'Billy Olsen', 'email': 'billy.olsen@canonical.com', 'username': 'billy-olsen'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-03 06:42:26.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/workflows.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/forms.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/tabs.py'], 'message': 'Fix shared firewall policy can not be displayed in horizon

When firewall policy is set to shared, it should be seen by any
users just like public images.

_model_query function of common_db_minxin.py in neutron has used
shared and tenant_id fields restored from token to construct the
query condition, so continuing to pass tenant_id as filters
condition will cause sql confusion, just delete them to keep
consistent with the approach python-neutronclient did.

Change-Id: Id891f735509275bd79eff52385ffce40069fc460
Closes-bug: 1294541
'}]
commit_message:
Fix shared firewall policy can not be displayed in horizon

When firewall policy is set to shared, it should be seen by any
users just like public images.

_model_query function of common_db_minxin.py in neutron has used
shared and tenant_id fields restored from token to construct the
query condition, so continuing to pass tenant_id as filters
condition will cause sql confusion, just delete them to keep
consistent with the approach python-neutronclient did.

Change-Id: Id891f735509275bd79eff52385ffce40069fc460
Closes-bug: 1294541

subject: non-admin user to query volume filter by az
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-15 07:21:45.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/v2/volumes.py', 'cinder/tests/api/v2/test_volumes.py'], 'message': "non-admin user to query volume filter by az

Now cinder limit non-admin user to query volume just filter by 'name',
'status', and 'metadata', those is hard code in cinder-api. So improve
this using config option and allow non-admin to query volume filter by
'availability zone'.

Change-Id: I141e0031835288bc52ebe76f834dc65d271df433
Implements: blueprint allow-non-admin-to-query-volume-filter-by-az
"}]
commit_message:
non-admin user to query volume filter by az

Now cinder limit non-admin user to query volume just filter by 'name',
'status', and 'metadata', those is hard code in cinder-api. So improve
this using config option and allow non-admin to query volume filter by
'availability zone'.

Change-Id: I141e0031835288bc52ebe76f834dc65d271df433
Implements: blueprint allow-non-admin-to-query-volume-filter-by-az

subject: catch NotFound errors when consuming or abandoning
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-12 21:10:00.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/conductors/single_threaded.py'], 'message': 'catch NotFound errors when consuming or abandoning

If the zk node disappears underneath the conductor before it attempts to
abandon or consume a job, consumption/abandonment would fail with an
uncaught exception, killing the conductor. Catching excp.NotFound corrects
this.

Change-Id: Iaa7d0d8d0ebbc76973f16d717cc3137c75fbfec2
'}]
commit_message:
catch NotFound errors when consuming or abandoning

If the zk node disappears underneath the conductor before it attempts to
abandon or consume a job, consumption/abandonment would fail with an
uncaught exception, killing the conductor. Catching excp.NotFound corrects
this.

Change-Id: Iaa7d0d8d0ebbc76973f16d717cc3137c75fbfec2

commit_message:
Raise timeout for test_conntrack_disassociate_fip

It seems that 15 secs is not always enough, so raise the timeout to
something guaranteed to indicate a failure.

Change-Id: I4821983ebb2ef9483c0d35737794ddb45ddd4ac6
Closes-Bug: #1421354

subject: Make the atom class an abstract class
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-13 21:03:19.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/atom.py'], 'message': 'Make the atom class an abstract class

To enforce the already existing behavior that atoms
have execute and revert methods (this is already the
de-facto behavior with its subclasses) we might as
well have the atom class be abstract and have methods
execute() and revert() that need to be implemented
in subclasses (which they already are).

Change-Id: Idfc25a7c2b01f674a065e3f467607eba4ab89a26
'}]
commit_message:
Make the atom class an abstract class

To enforce the already existing behavior that atoms
have execute and revert methods (this is already the
de-facto behavior with its subclasses) we might as
well have the atom class be abstract and have methods
execute() and revert() that need to be implemented
in subclasses (which they already are).

Change-Id: Idfc25a7c2b01f674a065e3f467607eba4ab89a26

subject: Add a BFS tree iterator
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-10 23:37:03.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/types/tree.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_types.py'], 'message': 'Add a BFS tree iterator

To complement the DFS iterator that we provide in our
tree helper/type class add a BFS iterator as well so that
when/if we extract this module to elsewhere we can have
a nice featureful (and hopefully useful) set of iterators
for folks to use.

Change-Id: I1bc10c25bb62a5ffc85863f3f894d5469db95ff6
'}]
commit_message:
Add a BFS tree iterator

To complement the DFS iterator that we provide in our
tree helper/type class add a BFS iterator as well so that
when/if we extract this module to elsewhere we can have
a nice featureful (and hopefully useful) set of iterators
for folks to use.

Change-Id: I1bc10c25bb62a5ffc85863f3f894d5469db95ff6

subject: Remove delayed decorator and replace with nicer method
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-14 05:46:25.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/worker_based/server.py'], 'message': 'Remove delayed decorator and replace with nicer method

Instead of having a delayed decorator that is in the module
have one that is attached onto the instance and that can log
how long it took for the target method to finally be ran.

Change-Id: Ie6e51b0a2a60a063554dfba7fcc321ecd6661949
'}]
commit_message:
Remove delayed decorator and replace with nicer method

Instead of having a delayed decorator that is in the module
have one that is attached onto the instance and that can log
how long it took for the target method to finally be ran.

Change-Id: Ie6e51b0a2a60a063554dfba7fcc321ecd6661949

commit_message:
Add iSCSI SCST Target support to cinder

Currently cinder supports tgt,lio targets.
We are adding SCST Target support in cinder.

Change-Id: I449143d125808d28758f3d438d7d1476a544c38b
Implements: blueprint scst-iscsi-backend-support

subject: use configured max_retries and retry_interval for database connection
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-13 09:00:02.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/alarm/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py', 'ceilometer/storage/__init__.py', 'ceilometer/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py', 'ceilometer/event/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': 'use configured max_retries and retry_interval for database connection

We are using retrying for database connection, but that decorator
can only have default value of max_retries and retry_interval because
it happens at import time. We should use configured values instead,
so this patch moves those code into inner function, which makes
retrying get parameters at running time.

We override max_retries for some rare case when using oslo.db, but
that is not the right behavior. For example, collector will connect
to metering and event databases, if one is sqlalchemy and the other
one is MongoDB then when MongoDB lost connection in serving time,
then the max_retries will be zero which will cause safe_mongo_call not
work as expected. The right behavior for that sqlalchemy problem
is enforcing max_retries when we pass it to connection __init__ method.

Note: This patch also applies the enforcement to alarm and event
sqlalchemy implementations.

ref: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/127128/9
Change-Id: Ia8bec410c1cabe850c8d033daef5a5a0ddae8954
Closes-Bug: #1421485
'}]
commit_message:
use configured max_retries and retry_interval for database connection

We are using retrying for database connection, but that decorator
can only have default value of max_retries and retry_interval because
it happens at import time. We should use configured values instead,
so this patch moves those code into inner function, which makes
retrying get parameters at running time.

We override max_retries for some rare case when using oslo.db, but
that is not the right behavior. For example, collector will connect
to metering and event databases, if one is sqlalchemy and the other
one is MongoDB then when MongoDB lost connection in serving time,
then the max_retries will be zero which will cause safe_mongo_call not
work as expected. The right behavior for that sqlalchemy problem
is enforcing max_retries when we pass it to connection __init__ method.

Note: This patch also applies the enforcement to alarm and event
sqlalchemy implementations.

ref: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/127128/9
Change-Id: Ia8bec410c1cabe850c8d033daef5a5a0ddae8954
Closes-Bug: #1421485
