subject: Handle paginated responses being disabled
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-03 18:57:19.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/resource.py', 'openstack/tests/network/v2/test_floating_ip.py', 'openstack/tests/test_resource.py', 'openstack/tests/object_store/v1/test_proxy.py'], 'message': "Handle paginated responses being disabled

There are certain APIs supporting pagination that may be disabled on the
server side which we can't discover or otherwise know, such as Neutron's
/networks as seen on devstack and in other environments. In order to
have the Resource.list method work seamlessly, we shift from making
an extra request past the end of data to identify the end towards
slow-starting the yielding of data. This also allows the Resource.list
method to work properly with GET calls which return lists but do not
even actively support pagination.

By not immediately yielding but waiting for the results of a second
call, we can check if we got the same response back, as is the case when
pagination is disabled on the server. When that happens, just end
iteration and give the caller what we have. When we get different data,
pagination is enabled and working, we continue iterating until we get
back an empty result, which signals that we'll yield the last result and
then exit.

This has no external effect on behavior when pagination is enabled
as expected.

Change-Id: Ic56f7a8f8a2bd86336e4a26e73e39bbe3ef82767
Closes-Bug: 1410980
"}]
commit_message:
Handle paginated responses being disabled

There are certain APIs supporting pagination that may be disabled on the
server side which we can't discover or otherwise know, such as Neutron's
/networks as seen on devstack and in other environments. In order to
have the Resource.list method work seamlessly, we shift from making
an extra request past the end of data to identify the end towards
slow-starting the yielding of data. This also allows the Resource.list
method to work properly with GET calls which return lists but do not
even actively support pagination.

By not immediately yielding but waiting for the results of a second
call, we can check if we got the same response back, as is the case when
pagination is disabled on the server. When that happens, just end
iteration and give the caller what we have. When we get different data,
pagination is enabled and working, we continue iterating until we get
back an empty result, which signals that we'll yield the last result and
then exit.

This has no external effect on behavior when pagination is enabled
as expected.

Change-Id: Ic56f7a8f8a2bd86336e4a26e73e39bbe3ef82767
Closes-Bug: 1410980

commit_message:
Remove duplicate token revocation check

Check whether V2 token is revoked has been performed twice, the first
check is in the method of validate_v2_token(...), and then check in
method _is_valid_token(...) again, remove the duplicated one.

Change-Id: Iaffe6473f5277f10540d5e1647c69d282250becf
Closes-Bug: #1414627

commit_message:
Support new devstack LIBS_FROM_GIT env variable

devstack has changed recently to install clients from Pypi instead of
from Git. See:

https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/commit/cc52406a78

This means that on a clean redstack install you will not be running the
latest clients by default, and any changes made to client code will not
be reflected in CLI testing.

The LIBS_FROM_GIT has been set to the list of common clients.  Namely:
    python-troveclient

    python-ceilometerclient
    python-cinderclient
    python-glanceclient
    python-heatclient
    python-keystoneclient
    python-neutronclient
    python-novaclient
    python-openstackclient
    python-saharaclient
    python-swiftclient

The following oslo libraries have also been included:
    cliff
    cookiecutter
    oslo.concurrency
    oslo.context
    oslo.config
    oslo-cookiecutter
    oslo.db
    oslo.i18n
    oslo.log
    oslo.messaging
    oslo.middleware
    oslo.rootwrap
    oslo.serialization
    oslosphinx
    oslotest
    oslo.utils
    oslo.version
    oslo.vmware
    pylockfile
    hacking
    pbr
    pyCADF
    stevedore
    taskflow
    tooz

Note: This only affects brand new installs on new machines. Machines
that have already run 'redstack install' will already have the necessary
links in place.

Change-Id: I805f9626c8d137b5c282783f1243c4d1c7d248ab
Closes-Bug: #1394672

Provide more readable error message when swift is not installed

When creating a backup with no swift, the error message is very
general. Added an exception handler to provide a more meaningful
error message.

Closes-bug 1395107

commit_message:
fix normal user can delete other user's ec2 credential

In current policy.v3cloudsample.json, we only check if the user
from token matchs the user from url. However, We also should check
if the user owns the deleting credential.

Change-Id: I92f53aeb2575a4d543ab4ec5044928fe929c4b03
Closes-Bug: #1417522

commit_message:
VMware: adapter_type volume type extra spec

The purpose of this blueprint is to allow the user to
specify the adapter_type as an extra spec in the cinder
volume type, so that any new cinder volume of that type
will have the specified adapter_type.

Change-Id: I0e19eadc23f2f5d2c90ad82aa1e8cbe0ebd36717
Implements: blueprint vmware-vol-adapter-type

subject: Set Resource.page limit to None
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-09 02:15:00.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/resource.py', 'openstack/tests/test_resource.py'], 'message': "Set Resource.page limit to None

Setting the Resource.page limit to None, which is how it gets used by
default from Resource.list, allows it to be used directly with the same
ease as Resource.list. For APIs which return lists but don't support
pagination, this allows us to provide users the same iteration behavior
across the board.

For an example of where this comes into play, a GET on /types in the
volume service returns a list of types in a single response with
no pagination support. If we call Types.list(session) it will be an
infinite loop. With this change, Types.page(session) allows the Type
proxy to yield type objects out of that one page.

Change-Id: I242a9fd0cd6d21b891d91e2fe69006a1f0ec3a15
"}]
commit_message:
Set Resource.page limit to None

Setting the Resource.page limit to None, which is how it gets used by
default from Resource.list, allows it to be used directly with the same
ease as Resource.list. For APIs which return lists but don't support
pagination, this allows us to provide users the same iteration behavior
across the board.

For an example of where this comes into play, a GET on /types in the
volume service returns a list of types in a single response with
no pagination support. If we call Types.list(session) it will be an
infinite loop. With this change, Types.page(session) allows the Type
proxy to yield type objects out of that one page.

Change-Id: I242a9fd0cd6d21b891d91e2fe69006a1f0ec3a15

subject: Add Resource.from_name
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-09 02:15:00.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/resource.py', 'openstack/tests/test_resource.py'], 'message': 'Add Resource.from_name

For the Volume v2 proxy, we need to be able to create volume types
from a name, which will then be assigned an ID. This change adds
`from_name`, much the same as the existing `from_id`, and reuses
the underlying implementation to create or return the Resource
depending on which attribute you want to create from.

Change-Id: Icb8b14cf346cbdff026bcc6741ebf863d5c8255f
'}]
commit_message:
Add Resource.from_name

For the Volume v2 proxy, we need to be able to create volume types
from a name, which will then be assigned an ID. This change adds
`from_name`, much the same as the existing `from_id`, and reuses
the underlying implementation to create or return the Resource
depending on which attribute you want to create from.

Change-Id: Icb8b14cf346cbdff026bcc6741ebf863d5c8255f

subject: MySql cookbook ver 6 changes
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-02-13 14:12:18.000000000', 'files': ['libraries/database.rb', 'spec/database_spec.rb', 'CHANGELOG.md', 'attributes/database.rb', 'metadata.rb'], 'message': "MySql cookbook ver 6 changes

mysql cookbook is now provider driver, and no longer has default
attributes, like server_root_password.
For the password, now always using the Common password methods.
Therefore the ['openstack']['db']['root_user_use_databag'] attribute
was removed, it's now the default path.

For the other mysql attributes we used, these were moved into the
ops-database cookbook.  See that patch for more info.

This patch requires updates to the database and mysql-chef-gem cookbooks.

Change-Id: I817030cd7fb56cb025e1a8e21dc2b956b0ad7911
Implements: blueprint trusty-juno
"}]
commit_message:
MySql cookbook ver 6 changes

mysql cookbook is now provider driver, and no longer has default
attributes, like server_root_password.
For the password, now always using the Common password methods.
Therefore the ['openstack']['db']['root_user_use_databag'] attribute
was removed, it's now the default path.

For the other mysql attributes we used, these were moved into the
ops-database cookbook.  See that patch for more info.

This patch requires updates to the database and mysql-chef-gem cookbooks.

Change-Id: I817030cd7fb56cb025e1a8e21dc2b956b0ad7911
Implements: blueprint trusty-juno

commit_message:
Add possibility to enable/disable some share protocols

It is useful in case we use share backends that do not implement some share
protocol or want to disable something for some other reason. For the moment,
there is no share driver that supports all share protocols in Manila.

Change-Id: I80a6a7927aa897931a84d310b657d0af06f02823
Closes-Bug: #1403161

commit_message:
Rename volume_type to share_type

This change adds support for share_type, share_types, and share_type_id
along side the corresponding volume_type, volume_types and
volume_type_id fields in the API. This change was made as share_type and
its references are more intuitive in comparison to volume_type.
Both entries are returned to ensure API compatibility but preference is
given to share_type[s,_id].

The database migration introduced in this change should work on MySQL
and Postgres, but will not work on SQLite. Because there is no point
in supporting SQLite, tests for it are removed.

Implements blueprint: rename-volume-type-to-share-type

Change-Id: Ifa23ee6520b5238c7de3d5bce7b7bbde02a4a61d

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-01 23:06:15.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/compute/v2/test_limits_absolute.py', 'openstack/compute/v2/limits_absolute.py'], 'message': 'LimitsAbsolute support get instead of list

The LimitsAbsolute class only supported the list method and was
returning one name/value paired limit at a time. It would be more usable
to set each of those name/value pairs as properties on one
LimitsAbsolute class.

Change-Id: Id28fa35667e649b8224feebade6a1dc71ae4a227
'}]
commit_message:
LimitsAbsolute support get instead of list

The LimitsAbsolute class only supported the list method and was
returning one name/value paired limit at a time. It would be more usable
to set each of those name/value pairs as properties on one
LimitsAbsolute class.

Change-Id: Id28fa35667e649b8224feebade6a1dc71ae4a227

commit_message:
Change how the API is getting a list of compute nodes

Instead of calling the DB API, we prefer to call the ComputeNode object methods
and change how the fields are accessed by backporting them to primitives if
needed.

Partially-Implements blueprint detach-service-from-computenode

Change-Id: Ibf9d2f58566a8fddd52fa32ee94fbb5ea9ffd3a5

commit_message:
Change how Cells are getting the list of compute nodes

Instead of calling the DB API, we prefer to call the object methods
for getting either a list or a item of ComputeNode objects.

Partially-Implements blueprint detach-service-from-computenode

Change-Id: I4ad9ed6e39b659ccbdc4372ff78d2b7366f4df19

Task specification improvement

add two new taskspec definitions, DirectWorkflowTaskSpec and
ReverseWorkflowTaskSpec, corresponding to 'direct' and 'reverse'
workflow types.

Change-Id: I0b6ac5cacbefc480babd69dca50f292fbd16e82f
Implements: blueprint mistral-specifications-design-improvements

subject: Provide one resource for Compute v2 Limits
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-14 19:44:17.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/compute/v2/limits_rate.py', 'openstack/tests/compute/v2/test_limits.py', 'openstack/tests/compute/v2/test_limits_rate.py', 'openstack/tests/compute/v2/test_proxy.py', 'openstack/tests/compute/v2/test_limits_absolute.py', 'openstack/compute/v2/_proxy.py', 'openstack/compute/v2/limits.py', 'openstack/compute/v2/limits_absolute.py'], 'message': 'Provide one resource for Compute v2 Limits

This change makes use of having Resources as property types and provides
one parent resource, Limits, to interact with the /limits REST API. As
this response body contains two different types of limits with two
different structures, it offers Limits.absolute and Limits.rate, which
replace the two separate resources that currently exist that require two
API calls to work with. Limits.absolute is an AbsoluteLimits instance,
and Limits.rate is a list of RateLimit instances.

The interaction would now work as follows:

my_limits = limits.Limits().get(session)
print(my_limits.absolute.server_meta) # 128 by default
for limits in my_limits.rate: # iterate over URIs with limits
    print(limits.uri) # prints "*/servers"
    for limit in limits:
        print(limit) # print the specific rate limits on this URI

Change-Id: Ib2692476a35a0db02ccbaee63e3365f920086a91
'}]
commit_message:
Provide one resource for Compute v2 Limits

This change makes use of having Resources as property types and provides
one parent resource, Limits, to interact with the /limits REST API. As
this response body contains two different types of limits with two
different structures, it offers Limits.absolute and Limits.rate, which
replace the two separate resources that currently exist that require two
API calls to work with. Limits.absolute is an AbsoluteLimits instance,
and Limits.rate is a list of RateLimit instances.

The interaction would now work as follows:

my_limits = limits.Limits().get(session)
print(my_limits.absolute.server_meta) # 128 by default
for limits in my_limits.rate: # iterate over URIs with limits
    print(limits.uri) # prints "*/servers"
    for limit in limits:
        print(limit) # print the specific rate limits on this URI

Change-Id: Ib2692476a35a0db02ccbaee63e3365f920086a91

commit_message:
Automatically mutate the docstring for deprecations

To ensure that the docstring is also updated we can just
dynamically update the object being decorated and append
on entries/lines to ensure people are aware of the current
or pending deprecation(s).

Change-Id: I41f89abeb2b165ad4073584c5b58157d9f1fd1f6

commit_message:
EMC VMAX driver Kilo update

This patch updated the VMAX driver for the Kilo release.
Main changes in this patch include the following:
* Support for consistency group.
* Support for VMAX V3.

Implements: blueprint emc-vmax-driver-kilo-update
Change-Id: I749d5f3071cd78e8ab14f3fd1711faeda7e33b77

commit_message:
Add support for host local disk sizes

Added interfaces to block device driver interface so local
storage drivers could return the capacity and used amount
of storage.

Broke out host stats testing into it's own file.

Change-Id: I260edc623f8bcf33a0339efc6d58b72a40d0f42f

subject: custom context manger for py27/py3x compatability
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-01-13 01:23:37.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_utils/tests/test_context.py', 'oslo_utils/context.py'], 'message': 'custom context manger for py27/py3x compatability

contextlib.nested logs a DeprecationWarning which fills up the logs
(example in Nova) as py3x does not support this. One alternative as
proposed by the DeprecationWarning is "With-statements now directly
support multiple context managers". However this means we'll add
a lot of '\' as the with statement cannot span lines.

The nested() implementation in this review is a drop-in replacement
for contextlib.nested() and we can avoid a lot of unnecessary code
changes. This implementation has been tested with the Nova unit
tests in review:
If92dc85aa6f9162a1bdec2201bc4a8895f6e8566

Change-Id: I09c7a9dd18fdab38e3f7ff5849843dd5724c9d59
'}]
commit_message:
custom context manger for py27/py3x compatability

contextlib.nested logs a DeprecationWarning which fills up the logs
(example in Nova) as py3x does not support this. One alternative as
proposed by the DeprecationWarning is "With-statements now directly
support multiple context managers". However this means we'll add
a lot of '\' as the with statement cannot span lines.

The nested() implementation in this review is a drop-in replacement
for contextlib.nested() and we can avoid a lot of unnecessary code
changes. This implementation has been tested with the Nova unit
tests in review:
If92dc85aa6f9162a1bdec2201bc4a8895f6e8566

Change-Id: I09c7a9dd18fdab38e3f7ff5849843dd5724c9d59

commit_message:
Set '[vmware]/vlan_interface' stanza in /etc/nova/nova.conf

- create section [vmware] in /etc/nova/nova.conf and put
  `vlan_interface' configuration stanza there instead of genereted files
  in /etc/nova/nova-compute.d/; nova-network service do not use them

Change-Id: Id0eca878d83966f524113e063428d876ac313bf7
Closes-bug: #1421939

assertTableColumns method is used to asserts that the table contains
the expected set of columns. There is a assert in assertTableColumns:
self.assertEqual(expected_cols.sort(), actual_cols.sort()).
However, the return of List.sort is None. So, this assert always

Closes-Bug: #1421092

commit_message:
fix assertTableColumns

assertTableColumns method is used to asserts that the table contains
the expected set of columns. There is a assert in assertTableColumns:
self.assertEqual(expected_cols.sort(), actual_cols.sort()).
However, the return of List.sort is None. So, this assert always
passes.

Change-Id: I4b5e48044cb466b1660484043b475ac6e2d9b35e
Closes-Bug: #1421092

subject: VMware: Fix clone volume example
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-13 07:13:45.000000000', 'files': ['doc/config-reference/block-storage/drivers/vmware-vmdk-driver.xml'], 'message': 'VMware: Fix clone volume example

The example for cloning a volume from another volume
is incomplete. The step for creating a source volume
with required volume type is missing. Also, it is not
necessary to specify the volume type of the destination
volume. This patch fixes these problems.

Change-Id: I3ad4d36f014bb32e25d300fb3c429347e3f65ce0
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: Fix clone volume example

The example for cloning a volume from another volume
is incomplete. The step for creating a source volume
with required volume type is missing. Also, it is not
necessary to specify the volume type of the destination
volume. This patch fixes these problems.

Change-Id: I3ad4d36f014bb32e25d300fb3c429347e3f65ce0

commit_message:
Cleanup explicit monkey patching in services

Now that we monkey patch neutron in neutron/__init__.py, we don't need
all those imports and explicit monkey patching in each of services.

Change-Id: I9ded92674727a5c6c3e3febd0b007b37132f57b3

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-07 15:29:04.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/cmd/sanity/checks.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/sanity/test_sanity.py', 'neutron/cmd/sanity_check.py'], 'message': "sanity_check: check bash installed for L3 HA

L3 HA uses bash scripts for notifications on state transitions. Since
bash may be not present on some systems for it's not part of LSB, it's
beteter to have the check available in sanity_check.

Note that there are some plans to get rid of the notifier script from L3
HA implementation [1], though its fate is unclear.

Change-Id: I5bacd6498b57a90080c37952c17063f81c71bae4
"}]
commit_message:
sanity_check: check bash installed for L3 HA

L3 HA uses bash scripts for notifications on state transitions. Since
bash may be not present on some systems for it's not part of LSB, it's
beteter to have the check available in sanity_check.

Note that there are some plans to get rid of the notifier script from L3
HA implementation [1], though its fate is unclear.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/125384/

Change-Id: I5bacd6498b57a90080c37952c17063f81c71bae4

commit_message:
Update 3PAR driver section for dedup provisioning

OpenStack Configuration Reference Guide updated
to include dedup as a valid hp3par:provisioning value. A note
was added that this feature requires SSD disks and
3PAR firmware version 3.2.1 MU1 or higher.

Change-Id: I7a63fbb6833d1ee59b565055ec6bcd4377057f4f
Closes-bug: 1421543

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 964, 'name': 'Anne Gentle', 'email': 'annegentle@justwriteclick.com', 'username': 'annegentle'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 7923, 'name': 'Gauvain Pocentek', 'email': 'gauvainpocentek@gmail.com', 'username': 'gpocentek'}, {'_account_id': 9382, 'name': 'Shilla Saebi', 'email': 'shilla.saebi@gmail.com', 'username': 'shillasaebi'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 14643, 'name': 'Olga Gusarenko', 'email': 'ogusarenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'Olga'}, {'_account_id': 14891, 'name': 'Lilia Sampaio', 'email': 'liliars@lsd.ufcg.edu.br', 'username': 'liliars'}, {'_account_id': 14947, 'name': 'Maria Zlatkova', 'email': 'mzlatkova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'mzlatkova'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-10 19:49:22.000000000', 'files': ['doc/common/ch_getstart.xml'], 'message': 'Clarify Swift's implementation definition in the Install Guide page

The current definition of Swift's implementation in the Install
Guide page is confusing and, therefore, incomplete. The root of
the confusion is as it follows: "Its implementation is not like
a file server with mountable directories.", which doesn't
actually explain what it is like. Clarify this concept adding
information about Swift's implementation.

Patch Set 2: Rewording of paragraph.
Patch Set 3: Small adjustment regarding grammar issues.

Change-Id: I9bca8bd1df758e5de1201231efb3c245f1cfe9a4
Closes-Bug: #1412456
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify Swift's implementation definition in the Install Guide page

The current definition of Swift's implementation in the Install
Guide page is confusing and, therefore, incomplete. The root of
the confusion is as it follows: "Its implementation is not like
a file server with mountable directories.", which doesn't
actually explain what it is like. Clarify this concept adding
information about Swift's implementation.

Patch Set 2: Rewording of paragraph.
Patch Set 3: Small adjustment regarding grammar issues.

Change-Id: I9bca8bd1df758e5de1201231efb3c245f1cfe9a4
Closes-Bug: #1412456

commit_message:
Adds local write affinity for object PUT requests

The proxy can now be configured to prefer local object servers for PUT
 requests, where "local" is governed by the "write_affinity". The
 "write_affinity_node_count" setting controls how many local object
 servers to try before giving up and going on to remote ones.

Patch rechecking.

Change-Id: I034273babfbae871770af217d3f1bcb8e7f04d47
Partial-Bug: #1192657

commit_message:
Create test plan when new swarm runner is started

Modify reporter script, so it can parse results of
system tests that are running at the moment.
Also if test failed try to find link to Launchpad
bug in previous results for the same test case. Copy
link to bug only if it's targeted to given project
and milestone and its status isn't 'Fix Released'.
In case linked bug is marked as duplicate of another
bug, check the status of that bug. If linked bug is
private or doesn't exist skip it.

Change-Id: I2392c81bcad6273ecbabfee479b74263fc7c0fbf
Closes-bug: #1419865

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-12 13:39:56.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/linux/test_keepalived.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l3_agent.py'], 'message': "Cleanup in keepalived tests

A recent patch introduced a new keepalived manager utility
function which returns the keepalived.conf file contents,
but the keepalived functional test was not updated to use it.
Also, a bunch of unneeded logging configuration was removed from
this test.

Additionally, the keepalived configuration functional test
in the L3 agent testing module compares expected configuration
to an in-memory representation of the configuration that will
be persisted to disk. It's better to compare the expected
configuation with what was actually written to disk.

Change-Id: I0d6f73c5326d2ba1960456a151a67517db5cce7a
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup in keepalived tests

A recent patch introduced a new keepalived manager utility
function which returns the keepalived.conf file contents,
but the keepalived functional test was not updated to use it.
Also, a bunch of unneeded logging configuration was removed from
this test.

Additionally, the keepalived configuration functional test
in the L3 agent testing module compares expected configuration
to an in-memory representation of the configuration that will
be persisted to disk. It's better to compare the expected
configuation with what was actually written to disk.

Change-Id: I0d6f73c5326d2ba1960456a151a67517db5cce7a

commit_message:
Mark conductor 'stop' method deprecation kwarg with versions

To make it known (when the warning message is emitted) what
version this was deprecated in and when it may be removed
in add those parameters to the 'removed_kwarg' decorator so that
users of conductors are aware of this information.

Change-Id: Iacc97831ccd96d68cea4bd7e65a967b5ff9e7dc5

subject: Add possibility to define driver mode within pre_test_hook for CI
revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2015-02-13 06:05:21.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/ci/pre_test_hook.sh', 'contrib/devstack/lib/manila'], 'message': 'Add possibility to define driver mode within pre_test_hook for CI

Make it possible to provide argument with boolean value to script
pre_test_hook.sh that will be considered for driver mode setting.
'False' means "no share servers handling" and
'True' means "handling of share servers exist".

It is useful for all drivers that do not handle share servers and are going
to have CI job with such setup.

Also, fix Nova service VM creation func within Devstack.

Change-Id: I4145986e224bb934503f79085ea6359d90d55755
'}]
commit_message:
Add possibility to define driver mode within pre_test_hook for CI

Make it possible to provide argument with boolean value to script
pre_test_hook.sh that will be considered for driver mode setting.
'False' means "no share servers handling" and
'True' means "handling of share servers exist".

It is useful for all drivers that do not handle share servers and are going
to have CI job with such setup.

Also, fix Nova service VM creation func within Devstack.

Change-Id: I4145986e224bb934503f79085ea6359d90d55755

commit_message:
Improve upon/adjust/move around new optional example

Instead of having the optional requirements example be a
example that is itself a unittest just move the example to be an
actual unit test that gets tested using the various engine types
and change the example to be something slightly different (but
shows the same kind of usage information).

subject: Fix startup deadlock
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-13 22:49:08.000000000', 'files': ['networking_l2gw/tests/unit/services/l2gateway/test_agent_scheduler.py', 'networking_l2gw/services/l2gateway/agent_scheduler.py'], 'message': "Fix startup deadlock

When accessing the plugins via the NeutronManager at startup, a weird
circular dependency causes the Server to stall.

Ensuring that plugins are loaded on demand avoids the issue. Also, we
don't need to cache the context.

Change-Id: Ic56835c4532795870275d2a5c614839e1cd57b9c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix startup deadlock

When accessing the plugins via the NeutronManager at startup, a weird
circular dependency causes the Server to stall.

Ensuring that plugins are loaded on demand avoids the issue. Also, we
don't need to cache the context.

Change-Id: Ic56835c4532795870275d2a5c614839e1cd57b9c

commit_message:
Move v2.1 virtual_interfaces api policy enforcement into REST API layer

This patch moves the policy enforcement into REST API layer for v2.1
virtual_interfaces extension and adds related unittest.

besides, added a common unit test function which can be shared by other
policy enforcement testing.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy
DocImpact

Change-Id: I0f7d1edc919acc8921c5b6db5c38219fdd45a0de

subject: Move BIND backend deps into backend
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-12 18:48:22.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/backend/bind9.pp', 'manifests/init.pp'], 'message': 'Move BIND backend deps into backend

This moves the BIND backend deps that were previously directly in
init.pp into the BIND9 backend.  This includes moving the configuration
for the /var/lib/designate state directory into the backend, since it
needs to be owned by the DNS group.

Change-Id: Ifc4b7d3240258331a6ad3ebc6b4064aa7d7eceed
'}]
commit_message:
Move BIND backend deps into backend

This moves the BIND backend deps that were previously directly in
init.pp into the BIND9 backend.  This includes moving the configuration
for the /var/lib/designate state directory into the backend, since it
needs to be owned by the DNS group.

Change-Id: Ifc4b7d3240258331a6ad3ebc6b4064aa7d7eceed

subject: Fix 'Number of new ports: 2' failure mode on test_hotplug_nic
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 1192, 'name': 'David Kranz', 'email': 'dkranz@redhat.com', 'username': 'david-kranz'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10980, 'name': 'Doug Wiegley', 'email': 'dougwig@parkside.io', 'username': 'dougw'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-13 03:38:59.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_network_basic_ops.py'], 'message': "Fix 'Number of new ports: 2' failure mode on test_hotplug_nic

After change ce34d2fcf10 merged became evident that this test fails because
there are 'too' many ports that match the server id. Looking closer this is
due to the fact that we compare the entire port dictionaries instead of just
uuids. This may lead to spurious failures, when some port attributes (like
the STATUS) changes during the test execution.

It should suffice comparing uuids rather than dictionaries.

Change-Id: I5fd25689ad73258b092cef62e5657871eedd8b30
Closes-bug: #1321207
"}]
commit_message:
Fix 'Number of new ports: 2' failure mode on test_hotplug_nic

After change ce34d2fcf10 merged became evident that this test fails because
there are 'too' many ports that match the server id. Looking closer this is
due to the fact that we compare the entire port dictionaries instead of just
uuids. This may lead to spurious failures, when some port attributes (like
the STATUS) changes during the test execution.

It should suffice comparing uuids rather than dictionaries.

Change-Id: I5fd25689ad73258b092cef62e5657871eedd8b30
Closes-bug: #1321207

commit_message:
Move existing tests to unit

The existing test files are all moved under keystone.tests.unit,
except the existing keystone.tests.unit are left in place.

The .testr.conf is updated so that unit tests are run by default
in tox envs, and a tox env can override the tests to run by
setting OS_TEST_PATH.

This is so functional tests can sit in keystone.tests.functional.

Change-Id: I065d3f56e22f344abdadd92b3b384b002b02d989

subject: remove heat from starting in grenade
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-13 22:12:05.000000000', 'files': ['features.yaml', 'test-features.sh'], 'message': "remove heat from starting in grenade

It turns out there is actually no support for heat in grenade, so what
we're actually doing is starting heat on old, testing it, then not
actually upgrading heat, or testing it afterwards.

Testing heat on old isn't the purpose of this job, so we should drop
configuring that service. The normal heat tempest jobs should cover
that case anyway.

Change-Id: Iccc9135ef7abb73a414fa59ec7bc24513aa6e6e2
"}]
commit_message:
remove heat from starting in grenade

It turns out there is actually no support for heat in grenade, so what
we're actually doing is starting heat on old, testing it, then not
actually upgrading heat, or testing it afterwards.

Testing heat on old isn't the purpose of this job, so we should drop
configuring that service. The normal heat tempest jobs should cover
that case anyway.

Change-Id: Iccc9135ef7abb73a414fa59ec7bc24513aa6e6e2

than CentOS 7, it's totally imaginable that someone would want
to build it.

commit_message:
Remove deprecated DEFAULT.root_helper

root_helper has been deprecated under [DEFAULT] since the quantum
to neutron rename. It's time to finally remove handling it.

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact
Partially-Implements: blueprint rootwrap-daemon-mode
Change-Id: I17cd62c8763430bf3a4b67ab5e9cf5b736065133

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-13 17:01:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/scheduler/ironic_fakes.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_host_manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_ironic_host_manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/fakes.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_filter_scheduler.py'], 'message': 'Change how HostManager is calling the service information

As we want to separate the compute node from its service information, we then
change how we can get the service by calling Service.get_by_topic instead of
using the service field from the ComputeNode object.

Change-Id: Ie81760fdb5b0c892de0f9ca6355c39c7bd67193f

commit_message:
Change how HostManager is calling the service information

As we want to separate the compute node from its service information, we then
change how we can get the service by calling Service.get_by_topic instead of
using the service field from the ComputeNode object.

Partially-Implements: blueprint detach-service-from-computenode

Change-Id: Ie81760fdb5b0c892de0f9ca6355c39c7bd67193f

commit_message:
Move scheduler.host_manager to use ComputeNode object

Instead of calling the DB API for getting the list of compute nodes,
we prefer to query ComputeNodeList.get_all to get a list of
ComputeNode objects and change how the HostManager and the filters
are getting its fields.

Partially-Implements blueprint detach-service-from-computenode

Change-Id: I0971a959c7ea40649dd0f3dd4e9faa3bacf06da5

subject: Add lambda task and complete implementation of assert task
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-13 19:32:00.000000000', 'files': ['os_tasklib/common/assert_task.py', 'os_tasklib/common/__init__.py', 'os_tasklib/common/lambda_task.py'], 'message': "Add lambda task and complete implementation of assert task

Add lambda task and complete implementation on assert task, both of
which take functions as constructor arguments, to be run at task
execute time against arguments supplied during execute time.  Lambda
task is for applying functions to generate new, transformed, and/or
consolidated outputs/data.  Assert task is for applying a
function/predicate on input data and assert the truth value of the
function/predicate's result.

Change-Id: Ib8a0a956011f00899e8bf8eea957655e9cffce97
"}]
commit_message:
Add lambda task and complete implementation of assert task

Add lambda task and complete implementation on assert task, both of
which take functions as constructor arguments, to be run at task
execute time against arguments supplied during execute time.  Lambda
task is for applying functions to generate new, transformed, and/or
consolidated outputs/data.  Assert task is for applying a
function/predicate on input data and assert the truth value of the
function/predicate's result.

Change-Id: Ib8a0a956011f00899e8bf8eea957655e9cffce97

commit_message:
removed destructor from cue.taskflow.client.Client

The destructor (the mere existence of it) is causing odd exceptions
to be thrown during shutdown.  Removing until we can figure out
how to deal with clean shutdown of the taskflow Client.

This change uses the proposed skip-if job filter to avoid running
{rally,grenade,tempest}-dsvm-neutron jobs when the files in the
patchset are deemed not to influence their execution.

Another skip-if job filter is added to avoid running non-doc jobs
(neutron-{python27,dsvm-api,dsvm-functional}) against doc-only neutron
changes.

Change-Id: I638ac2d35c33eef02e2c6872ea3bd4a3d644da58
Depends-On: I9b261f03ec00426160d9396f3a20312e89b624d4

commit_message:
Add conditional skips for neutron jobs

This change uses the proposed skip-if job filter to avoid running
{rally,grenade,tempest}-dsvm-neutron jobs when the files in the
patchset are deemed not to influence their execution.

Another skip-if job filter is added to avoid running non-doc jobs
(neutron-{python27,dsvm-api,dsvm-functional}) against doc-only neutron
changes.

Change-Id: I638ac2d35c33eef02e2c6872ea3bd4a3d644da58
Depends-On: I9b261f03ec00426160d9396f3a20312e89b624d4

commit_message:
Change fixed/floating ip clients to return one value and update tests

Add ResponseBodyData for cases like delete_floating_ips_bulk where a
string is returned as the body. The client has to dereference the data
but I think this is a bit cleaner than having some methods return two values.

Partially implements: blueprint clients-return-one-value

Change-Id: I87b092b2dd2a231049fc39312038f2a2d5101028

commit_message:
Cover ListOfObjectField for relationship test

We should cover the ListOfObjectField when testing the object
relationships, so that if an object that is included as ListOfObjectField
has version changed, the parent object should bump version correspondingly.

Change-Id: I87fbf557219ae9cc32c7976c6683862c6387cf78

commit_message:
Fix find AlarmDefinition by dimension

Some of the SQL wasn't updated when the tables were renamed

Also, rename SubAlarmQueries to match its use in AlarmDefinitions

Fix alarm.sql so AlarmDefinitionMySqlRepositoryImplTest runs

Add more comprehensive unit tests that would have caught this error

commit_message:
Add dedup provisioning to 3PAR drivers

3PAR now supports thin duplication provisioning. This review is for
adding the dedup provisioning support to the 3PAR provisioning extra
specs type as well as supporting volume retype between provisioning
types (thin<->dedup, full<->dedup).

The OpenStack Configuration Reference Guide will need to updated
to include dedup as a valid hp3par:provisioning value. A note
should also be added that this feature requires SSD disks and
3PAR firmware version 3.2.1 MU1 or greater.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint 3par-dedup

Change-Id: I6ebad3682d5d53a9b1a6329d666a1d7fb06eba0a

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-11 23:56:35.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/providers/common.py', 'keystone/tests/test_v3_federation.py'], 'message': "Add a check to see if a federation token is being used for v2 auth

If a user has a federation environment, and doesn't update nova
to use v3 auth in auth_token, then they will automatically be
using v2 auth, which causes a fairly useless error to bubble up.
We should check if the user is using a fedration token in v2 and
provider a better error message.

Change-Id: I9c490df8dd38e9fa1f393ebfa1296b64fb0c9527
Closes-Bug: #1419114
"}]
commit_message:
Add a check to see if a federation token is being used for v2 auth

If a user has a federation environment, and doesn't update nova
to use v3 auth in auth_token, then they will automatically be
using v2 auth, which causes a fairly useless error to bubble up.
We should check if the user is using a fedration token in v2 and
provider a better error message.

Change-Id: I9c490df8dd38e9fa1f393ebfa1296b64fb0c9527
Closes-Bug: #1419114

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-01-29 08:21:34.000000000', 'files': ['etc/keystone.conf.sample', 'keystone/common/config.py', 'keystone/common/ldap/core.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend_ldap.py'], 'message': 'Use id attribute map for read-only LDAP

For read-only LDAP, we have no control over the DIT. We can only use the
attribute maps. Therefore, we need to honor the attribute map for all
attributes.

This patch also added the missing ID attribute when creating an object in
LDAP. For lookup, we also need the ID attribute to be returned.

Conflicts:
	keystone/tests/test_backend_ldap.py

Change-Id: I57c099eefdca7e756d294c35cf5b70d119c5c955
closes-bug: #1361306
closes-bug: #1340041
(cherry picked from commit 47e09d5dda70b2da87ec5a0fc4608373418870f9)
'}]
commit_message:
Use id attribute map for read-only LDAP

For read-only LDAP, we have no control over the DIT. We can only use the
attribute maps. Therefore, we need to honor the attribute map for all
attributes.

This patch also added the missing ID attribute when creating an object in
LDAP. For lookup, we also need the ID attribute to be returned.

Conflicts:
	keystone/tests/test_backend_ldap.py

Change-Id: I57c099eefdca7e756d294c35cf5b70d119c5c955
closes-bug: #1361306
closes-bug: #1340041
(cherry picked from commit 47e09d5dda70b2da87ec5a0fc4608373418870f9)

This test doesn't require use of this specific port,

commit_message:
Tests: Don't require binding to port 4444

If some other process is listening on port 4444,
test_server_pool_waitall will fail with:

error: [Errno 98] Address already in use

This test doesn't require use of this specific port,
so let it pick an unused port to avoid this failure.

Closes-Bug: #1421759

Change-Id: Ib92797e41a2bd37a59d3465b4764f00c1d9c2444

subject: IP filtering is not accurate when used with limit
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6062, 'name': 'jichenjc', 'email': 'jichenjc@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'jichenjc'}, {'_account_id': 9569, 'name': 'Sergey Nikitin', 'email': 'nikitinserv@gmail.com', 'username': 'snikitin'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10559, 'name': 'Steven Kaufer', 'email': 'kaufer@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'kaufer'}, {'_account_id': 11103, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'otc_cloud@163.com', 'username': 'intelotccloud', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12604, 'name': 'Adelina Tuvenie', 'email': 'atuvenie@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'atuvenie'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-02-13 16:35:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'IP filtering is not accurate when used with limit

When applying an IP address filter to a servers query, the IP address
filtering is manually applied in the compute API against the servers that are
retrieved from the DB.

The problem is when a limit is supplied; in this case, the IP address filter
is only applied to the page of servers that are returned from the DB. For
example, assume that you have 3 instances that match a given IP address filter
and that those instances are returned from the DB in the 5th, 20th, and 100th
positions. If you supply this IP address filter with a limit of 10, then only
a single server is returned (the one in the 5th position). In this case, all
3 instances should have been returned.

This patch set fixes this by removing the limit from the DB query (if an IP
address filter is supplied) and manually limiting the servers as the IP
address filter is being applied.

Alternative solutions that were not chosen:
* Moving the IP address filtering into the DB: Too complex since the network
  information is cached in the DB as a JSON object
* Determining server UUIDs that match the IP address filter and then using
  those as a DB UUID filter: This solution was originally implemented but
  deemed to expensive, see commit I455f6ab4acdecacc5152b11a183027f933dc4475

DocImpact
Closes-bug: 1417649

Change-Id: I6cb9feb77cf563d7aa7c3d4d2ce7e4a3e939a0bc
'}]
commit_message:
IP filtering is not accurate when used with limit

When applying an IP address filter to a servers query, the IP address
filtering is manually applied in the compute API against the servers that are
retrieved from the DB.

The problem is when a limit is supplied; in this case, the IP address filter
is only applied to the page of servers that are returned from the DB. For
example, assume that you have 3 instances that match a given IP address filter
and that those instances are returned from the DB in the 5th, 20th, and 100th
positions. If you supply this IP address filter with a limit of 10, then only
a single server is returned (the one in the 5th position). In this case, all
3 instances should have been returned.

This patch set fixes this by removing the limit from the DB query (if an IP
address filter is supplied) and manually limiting the servers as the IP
address filter is being applied.

Alternative solutions that were not chosen:
* Moving the IP address filtering into the DB: Too complex since the network
  information is cached in the DB as a JSON object
* Determining server UUIDs that match the IP address filter and then using
  those as a DB UUID filter: This solution was originally implemented but
  deemed to expensive, see commit I455f6ab4acdecacc5152b11a183027f933dc4475

DocImpact
Closes-bug: 1417649

Change-Id: I6cb9feb77cf563d7aa7c3d4d2ce7e4a3e939a0bc

commit_message:
Cleanup tests to not set multiple workers.

Setting multiple workers has no affect in the tests and doesn't
exercise multiple worker process code paths as the comment says.

These settings are removed to prevent confusion.

subject: Update apt cache after adding repos or pinning
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-13 19:23:26.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/roles/common/tasks/repos.yml', 'rpc_deployment/roles/common/tasks/apt_pinning.yml'], 'message': 'Update apt cache after adding repos or pinning

This patch implements a forced apt cache update after a new apt
repository is added, or any apt pinning is implemented.

This ensures that apt is sure about what packages are available to it,
and which packages/repositories should be preferred above others.

Change-Id: I2f6e9fa33c7765e8ed8aeaf4ea60be696125c186
Closes-Bug: #1421679
(cherry picked from commit b707e133339983d838eb59dbc624e18a22976ad7)
'}]
commit_message:
Update apt cache after adding repos or pinning

This patch implements a forced apt cache update after a new apt
repository is added, or any apt pinning is implemented.

This ensures that apt is sure about what packages are available to it,
and which packages/repositories should be preferred above others.

Change-Id: I2f6e9fa33c7765e8ed8aeaf4ea60be696125c186
Closes-Bug: #1421679
(cherry picked from commit b707e133339983d838eb59dbc624e18a22976ad7)

commit_message:
Consolidating conf and scripts

After much discussion with our esteemed PTL, the following are agreed upon:
1. Move _script to the header
2. Keep _conf and _script largely intact

Also fixes Hogan async template loading issue.
Also removed type and charset from script tags.

Change-Id: If267e937759dd381cfbc0582ab82456cdb5470c9
Closes-Bug: #1402016

commit_message:
Improve the library's documentation

This commit is the first step in improving the library's documentation.
It adds missing details to a lot of the default cookiecutter docs which
have mostly sat untouched since the repo was created. The release notes
are also brought up to date and adds autodoc pages for all the modules
with public functions.

Change-Id: Id249c95fb269d07628952a4182675bce1fc18a53

commit_message:
Move all puppet templates into puppet directory.

This cleans up the top level tree by moving all the puppet
related bits into the puppet directory. The only exception
is overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml which is
the puppet environment file and is used externally.

Change-Id: Idb65a7143b0f29e5579d4e9d1642e4cda6f65d50

Gate nodes appear to be in power on state when added to Ironic. This
is causing depolys to fail. This patch changes the conductor manager
so that if force_power_state_during_sync is true and the database
state is none the nodes power is set to off. If

Closes-Bug: #1300589

commit_message:
Default newly enrolled nodes to power_off

Gate nodes appear to be in power on state when added to Ironic. This
is causing depolys to fail. This patch changes the conductor manager
so that if force_power_state_during_sync is true and the database
state is none the nodes power is set to off. If
force_power_state_during_sync is false then the nodes power current
state is still used.

DocImpact
Change-Id: If3c1603b50f6ed1f33217dce3c492e6bcb28963b
Closes-Bug: #1300589

commit_message:
Implement local scripts for all gate tests

This patch implements the following:
 - scripts-library.sh which includes commonly used functions, variables
   and other preparation commands for all other scripts
 - bootstrap-ansible.sh which only deploys a selected version of ansible
   and ensures that any other requirements are prepared on the
   deployment host
 - bootstrap-aio.sh which runs all host preparation actions for an
   all-in-one build
 - gate-check-lint.sh which runs a lint and syntax check
 - gate-check-commit.sh which runs all actions required for a gate
   commit check, utilising the other scripts where required
 - run-smoke-test.sh which runs tempest from inside the utility container
 - run-playbooks.sh which runs the playbooks
 - the existing conf.d/swift.yml is renamed to be an example
   configuration - the example configurations can be used as
   documentation
 - etc/network/interfaces.d/aio_interfaces.cfg,
   etc/rpc_deploy/conf.d/swift.yml and
   etc/rpc_deploy/rpc_user_config.yml are now configurations used for
   the AIO deployment
 - a workaround for https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1244589 to ensure
   that DHCP checksums are implemented by the host which is required for
   the smoke tests to work
 - the removal of the rpc heat templates as they're unusable in their
   current state
 - setting MAX_RETRIES to 0, ensuring that any failures cause an
   immediate commit check failure in the gate - this prevents the
   masking of failures by retry attempts

Conflicts:
        etc/rpc_deploy/rpc_user_config.yml
        scripts/rpc-aio-heat-template.yml
        scripts/rpc-aio-rax-heat-template.yml
        scripts/run-aio-build.sh

DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
Closes-Bug: #1415883
Closes-Bug: #1417999
Closes-Bug: #1419807
Change-Id: I95242d48ad0fb055f16510803c8aa14dc183ac17
(cherry picked from commit 6b12bf366369d7b1d0f5bdfbc8afc05f447363fb)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-13 06:20:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/instance.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_instance.py'], 'message': 'Pass instance primitive to instance_update_at_top()

This change sends an instance primitive to instance_update_at_top()
instead of sending an SQLAlchemy model.

Since the flavor-from-sysmeta-to-blob patches merged, the
check-tempest-dsvm-cells has experienced errors related to updating
instance extras. The problem occurs when Instance.save() passes an
SQLAlchemy model to the cells RPC API. When the cells RPC layer
attempts to serialize the instance (using jsonutils.to_primitive())
for the nova/cells/messaging.py side, often a DetachedInstanceError
is raised as extras attributes are attempted to be lazy-loaded
(object not bound to session).

Change-Id: If5c19e5ac82ebdfaf973da388f9fbff516169d60
'}]
commit_message:
Pass instance primitive to instance_update_at_top()

This change sends an instance primitive to instance_update_at_top()
instead of sending an SQLAlchemy model.

Since the flavor-from-sysmeta-to-blob patches merged, the
check-tempest-dsvm-cells has experienced errors related to updating
instance extras. The problem occurs when Instance.save() passes an
SQLAlchemy model to the cells RPC API. When the cells RPC layer
attempts to serialize the instance (using jsonutils.to_primitive())
for the nova/cells/messaging.py side, often a DetachedInstanceError
is raised as extras attributes are attempted to be lazy-loaded
(object not bound to session).

Change-Id: If5c19e5ac82ebdfaf973da388f9fbff516169d60

commit_message:
Small cleanup in pci_device_update

Method was doing fetch, update. Update to do update, fetch, which is
more obviously correct. At the same time, don't re-add an existing
object to the session, which probably doesn't matter but was
unnecessary.

Change-Id: I9920902b7378114aa55b7a8f4e8dd7dcc8b40633

subject: fix a use after free bug in the pkcs11 plugin
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7136, 'name': 'Chad Lung', 'email': 'chad.lung@gmail.com', 'username': 'chadlung'}, {'_account_id': 7262, 'name': 'John Vrbanac', 'email': 'john.vrbanac@linux.com', 'username': 'john.vrbanac'}, {'_account_id': 8004, 'name': 'Paul Kehrer', 'email': 'paul.l.kehrer@gmail.com', 'username': 'reaperhulk'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-13 18:51:17.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/plugin/crypto/p11_crypto.py'], 'message': 'fix a use after free bug in the pkcs11 plugin

When generating the mechanism for encrypting/decrypting we allocated
the GCM struct and assigned it but then returned the mechanism. This
caused the variable holding ownership in Python to be out of scope and
the GCM struct was marked for garbage collection. A classic use after
free bug. Ugh. Credit for finding this goes to Rohit Bansal

This CR additionally creates namedtuples to hold references to the
data and more elegantly prevent this bug.

Change-Id: Ic105c569328d599ca2e989e4413381d658cefe02
'}]
commit_message:
fix a use after free bug in the pkcs11 plugin

When generating the mechanism for encrypting/decrypting we allocated
the GCM struct and assigned it but then returned the mechanism. This
caused the variable holding ownership in Python to be out of scope and
the GCM struct was marked for garbage collection. A classic use after
free bug. Ugh. Credit for finding this goes to Rohit Bansal

This CR additionally creates namedtuples to hold references to the
data and more elegantly prevent this bug.

Change-Id: Ic105c569328d599ca2e989e4413381d658cefe02

commit_message:
Angular Confirmation Modal

We need a simple dialog for confirming dangerous actions such as delete.
This patch introduces a simple wrapper that allows user to pass in:
1. Title - title of the dialog
2. Body - simple text or html (not a template!)
3. Submit label
4. Cancel label

Change-Id: Ibe019bf8a2d08c6323ebb6e39bfac7dcac8852c6
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-identity-tables

subject: Make container GET call authorize when account not found
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-09 18:08:51.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/container.py'], 'message': "Make container GET call authorize when account not found

When an account was not found, ContainerController would
return 404 unconditionally for a container GET or HEAD request,
without checking that the request was authorized.

This patch modifies the GETorHEAD method to first call any
callback method registered under 'swift.authorize' in the
request environ and prefer any response from that over the 404.

Closes-Bug: 1415957

Change-Id: I4f41fd9e445238e14af74b6208885d83698cc08d
"}]
commit_message:
Make container GET call authorize when account not found

When an account was not found, ContainerController would
return 404 unconditionally for a container GET or HEAD request,
without checking that the request was authorized.

This patch modifies the GETorHEAD method to first call any
callback method registered under 'swift.authorize' in the
request environ and prefer any response from that over the 404.

Closes-Bug: 1415957

Change-Id: I4f41fd9e445238e14af74b6208885d83698cc08d

commit_message:
Remove and/or rename Rackspace related bits

This patch removes and/or renames anything that is Rackspace specific
from the playbooks, roles and variables.

It also removes items which appear to be orphaned/unused and flattens
the playbooks into a single directory in order to better match ansible
best practise (and remove some horrible fiddles we were doing).

The following have been removed due to RAX/RPC naming or RAX/RPC
specific usage:
 - playbooks/monitoring
 - playbooks/rax*
 - playbooks/rpc*
 - roles/maas*
 - roles/rax*
 - roles/rpc*
 - scripts/f5-*
 - scripts/maas*
 - scripts/rpc*
 - scripts/*lab*
 - vars/repo_packages/rackspace*
 - vars/repo_packages/rax*
 - vars/repo_packages/rpc*
 - vars/repo_packages/holland.yml

The following have been removed as they are unused:
 - playbooks/setup/host-network-setup.yml
 - roles/openssl_pem_request
 - roles/host_interfaces
 - scripts/elsa*
 - ssh/
 - vars/repo_packages/turbolift.yml

The following directories have been renamed:
 - etc/rpc_deploy > etc/openstack_deploy
 - rpc_deployment > playbooks

The playbooks have all been moved into a single directory:
 - rpc_deployment/playbooks/infrastructure/* > playbooks/
 - rpc_deployment/playbooks/openstack/* > playbooks/
 - rpc_deployment/playbooks/setup/* > playbooks/

The following files have been renamed:
 - lxc-rpc > lxc-openstack
 - lxc-rpc.conf > lxc-openstack.conf
 - rpc_environment > openstack_environment
 - rpc_release > openstack_release (etc and pip)
 - rpc_tempest_gate.sh > openstack_tempest_gate.sh
 - rpc_user_config > openstack_user_config

The following variables have been renamed:
 - rpc_release > openstack_release
 - rpc_repo_url > openstack_repo_url

The following variables have been introduced:
 - openstack_code_name: The code name of the upstream OpenStack release
   (eg: Juno)

Notable variable/template value changes:
 - rabbit_cluster_name: rpc > openstack
 - wsrep_cluster_name: rpc_galera_cluster > openstack_galera_cluster

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1403676
Implements: blueprint rackspace-namesake
Change-Id: Ib480fdad500b03c7cb90684aa444da9946ba8032

commit_message:
Fix data leakage for containers with common X-Versions-Location

The name of the objects versions were changed to include their
source container in order to prevent objects from different
sources with the same name from replace objects in the wrong
container. A test case had to be changed to handle the new
name convention

Change-Id: Ibc55f9d50acd02366e7f1269dc477d3fe64dfb6d
Closes-Bug: #1138531

subject: Fix logger test coupling
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-12 15:40:31.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix logger test coupling

Two tests fail if test/unit/common/test_daemon.py is excluded
from the test set:

test.unit.common.test_utils.TestUtils.test_swift_log_formatter
test.unit.common.test_utils.TestStatsdLoggingDelegation.test_thread_locals

They fail because they assert that logger.txn_id is None,
when previous tests cause txn_id to be set. This coupling is masked
when test_daemon.py is included because it reloads the common/utils
module, and is executed just before test.unit.common.test_utils.

The coupling can be observed by running, for example:

nosetests ./test/unit/common/middleware/test_except.py ./test/unit/common/test_utils.py
or
nosetests ./test/unit/proxy ./test/unit/common/test_utils.py

The failing tests should reset logger thread_locals before making
assertions. test_utils.reset_loggers() attempts this but is broken
because it sets thread_local on the wrong object.

Changes in this patch:
 - fix reset_loggers() to reset the LogAdapter thread local state
 - add a reset_logger_state decorator to call reset_loggers
   before and after a decorated method
 - use the decorator for increased isolation of tests that previously
   called reset_loggers only on exit

Change-Id: If9aa781a2dd1929a47ef69322ec8c53263d47660
'}]
commit_message:
Fix logger test coupling

Two tests fail if test/unit/common/test_daemon.py is excluded
from the test set:

test.unit.common.test_utils.TestUtils.test_swift_log_formatter
test.unit.common.test_utils.TestStatsdLoggingDelegation.test_thread_locals

They fail because they assert that logger.txn_id is None,
when previous tests cause txn_id to be set. This coupling is masked
when test_daemon.py is included because it reloads the common/utils
module, and is executed just before test.unit.common.test_utils.

The coupling can be observed by running, for example:

nosetests ./test/unit/common/middleware/test_except.py ./test/unit/common/test_utils.py
or
nosetests ./test/unit/proxy ./test/unit/common/test_utils.py

The failing tests should reset logger thread_locals before making
assertions. test_utils.reset_loggers() attempts this but is broken
because it sets thread_local on the wrong object.

Changes in this patch:
 - fix reset_loggers() to reset the LogAdapter thread local state
 - add a reset_logger_state decorator to call reset_loggers
   before and after a decorated method
 - use the decorator for increased isolation of tests that previously
   called reset_loggers only on exit

Change-Id: If9aa781a2dd1929a47ef69322ec8c53263d47660

subject: patch out nova libvirt driver event thread in tests
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11103, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'otc_cloud@163.com', 'username': 'intelotccloud', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-13 13:54:16.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/fixtures.py', 'nova/test.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/test_virt_drivers.py'], 'message': "patch out nova libvirt driver event thread in tests

The nova libvirt driver spawns a native thread to listen to events
coming from libvirt. This thread is spawned on driver
initialization. During testing we initial the libvirt driver quite a
lot, which means we've got extra threads flapping around during
tests. Even though these mostly are in an idle sleep loop, we have
tests that ensure sleeps happen in a particular order, called a
particular way (to ensure retry/fallback happens as expected). Which
means these threads are a source of race conditions in the tests.

The following adds a disable_event_loop call in fakelibvirt which can
either be called explicitly, or will always be used as part of the
fakelibvirt fixture.

To ensure this is doing what we think, this also adds a
PoisonFunctions fixture which does a global patch of the problematic
function to a sys.exit. So if any code calls that function without
locally patching it, the test dies. A sys.exit was used instead of an
exception to ensure we bypass any error handling, as touching this
function without patching is something we definitely want to avoid.

Change-Id: I813ea6abe168d3ae3b3b22fac1c6772615235eaa
"}]
commit_message:
patch out nova libvirt driver event thread in tests

The nova libvirt driver spawns a native thread to listen to events
coming from libvirt. This thread is spawned on driver
initialization. During testing we initial the libvirt driver quite a
lot, which means we've got extra threads flapping around during
tests. Even though these mostly are in an idle sleep loop, we have
tests that ensure sleeps happen in a particular order, called a
particular way (to ensure retry/fallback happens as expected). Which
means these threads are a source of race conditions in the tests.

The following adds a disable_event_loop call in fakelibvirt which can
either be called explicitly, or will always be used as part of the
fakelibvirt fixture.

To ensure this is doing what we think, this also adds a
PoisonFunctions fixture which does a global patch of the problematic
function to a sys.exit. So if any code calls that function without
locally patching it, the test dies. A sys.exit was used instead of an
exception to ensure we bypass any error handling, as touching this
function without patching is something we definitely want to avoid.

Change-Id: I813ea6abe168d3ae3b3b22fac1c6772615235eaa

commit_message:
Add standalone network plugin

This network plugin can be used with any network platform.

Features:
- Serves flat networks as well as segmented.
- Does not require some specific network services in OpenStack like Neutron or
Nova.
- Can handle IPv6 as well as IPv4
- The only thing that plugin does is reservation and release of IP addresses
from some network.

Can be configured using following options:
- standalone_network_plugin_gateway [required]
- standalone_network_plugin_mask [required]
- standalone_network_plugin_segmentation_id [optional] [default: None]
- standalone_network_plugin_allowed_ip_ranges [optional] [default: None]
- standalone_network_plugin_ip_version [optional] [default: 4]

Implements blueprint standalone-network-plugin

Change-Id: Ic9947dead1af2114ae0834b644ab19c7020232c3

commit_message:
Libvirt: cleanup rescue lvm when unrescue

Nova libvirt driver creates a uuid.rescue lvm when doing rescue,
but forget to cleanup it after unrescue to normal lvm.

This patch cleanups rescue lvm when doing unrescue.
Besides, add test_unrescue unit test case(missing before).

Closes-Bug: 1385480
Change-Id: Id5d188171e0495e00e95978d60cae7534521e92c

commit_message:
Change commands name from net-* to tenant-network-*

Currently the commands of os-tenant-network API use net-*
which may confuse users sometime. This patch changes commands
to tenant-network-*, and marks net-* commands as DEPRECATED.

Closes-Bug: #1152862
Change-Id: I8c3a0be08763a6f626d7fc7cf84811ac61ccc526

subject: Add support for removing all l3 routers from agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-11 20:50:38.000000000', 'files': ['files/default/neutron-ha-tool.py'], 'message': 'Add support for removing all l3 routers from agent

The neutron-ha-tool.py tool has the ability to rebalance routers on l3
agents, this adds the ability to remove all the routers from one l3
agent so it can be taken down for maintenance.  Just something that is a
minor change but quite handy to have available.

Also added the ability to read the region, if your neutron needs it.

Change-Id: I17d8f6f8c707dd6be0e64ccc2d5637b72b8ed392
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for removing all l3 routers from agent

The neutron-ha-tool.py tool has the ability to rebalance routers on l3
agents, this adds the ability to remove all the routers from one l3
agent so it can be taken down for maintenance.  Just something that is a
minor change but quite handy to have available.

Also added the ability to read the region, if your neutron needs it.

commit_message:
Fix symmetric/asymmetric key order meta validation

The attribute 'algorithm' is now required in the metadata provided in
symmetric/asymmetric key order requests.

Even though 'mode' might be required in symmetric calls, Proper
handling of this attribute is left out of the scope of this CR.

Change-Id: I21edd9031584cbebea120e7766291c4bff00d127
Related-Bug: #1376902

commit_message:
Update VagrantFile files

Reasons:
 - Could not run `vagrant up` because chef-client isn't the good provider to
 used
 - vagrant 1.7.2 returns following errors:
   * The following settings shouldn't exist: chef_server_url
   * When 'environment' is specified, you must provide
   'environments_path'.

Changes:
 - Use `role_path` and `environements_path`
 - Remove `chef_server_url` assertion

Change-Id: I4df64b61b18ab359db3f4d34111dc5c3d69e711e

* Update install/ubuntu to be a Juno guide

commit_message:
Support assigning IPMI credentials in ironic-discoverd-ramdisk

When setting IPMI credentials is requested, ironic-discoverd
will return ipmi_setup_credentials=true, ipmi_username and ipmi_password
in response. Use ipmitool to set credentials in this case.

Change-Id: I8ace9e817e5ce9dbfb8564feec4a3ce6c0e1b233

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-12 22:22:32.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/ring/test_utils.py', 'swift/account/reaper.py'], 'message': 'Fix account-reaper

As part of commit efb39a5, the account reaper grew a bind_port
attribute, but it wasn't being converted to int, so naturally "6002"
!= 6002, and it wouldn't reap anything.

The bind_port was only used for determining the local devices. Rather
than fix the code to call int(), this commit removes the need for
bind_port entirely by skipping the port check. If your rings have IPs,
this is the same behavior as pre-efb39a5, and if your rings have
hostnames, this still works.

Change-Id: I7bd18e9952f7b9e0d7ce2dce230ee54c5e23709a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix account-reaper

As part of commit efb39a5, the account reaper grew a bind_port
attribute, but it wasn't being converted to int, so naturally "6002"
!= 6002, and it wouldn't reap anything.

The bind_port was only used for determining the local devices. Rather
than fix the code to call int(), this commit removes the need for
bind_port entirely by skipping the port check. If your rings have IPs,
this is the same behavior as pre-efb39a5, and if your rings have
hostnames, this still works.

Change-Id: I7bd18e9952f7b9e0d7ce2dce230ee54c5e23709a

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 7369, 'name': 'Sergey Skripnick', 'email': 'sskripnick@mirantis.com', 'username': 'redixin'}, {'_account_id': 8507, 'name': 'Mikhail Dubov', 'email': 'mdubov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'msdubov'}, {'_account_id': 9545, 'name': 'Andriy Kurilin', 'email': 'andr.kurilin@gmail.com', 'username': 'akurilin'}, {'_account_id': 10475, 'name': 'Alexander Maretskiy', 'email': 'amaretskiy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'maretskiy'}, {'_account_id': 14135, 'name': 'Mirantis Rally CI', 'email': 'redixin@yandex.ru', 'username': 'rci49'}, {'_account_id': 14817, 'name': 'Mirantis Rally CI', 'email': 'rally-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ci50'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 32, 'created': '2015-02-13 11:30:42.000000000', 'files': ['tests/functional/test_cli_task.py', 'rally/api.py', 'tools/rally.bash_completion', 'tests/unit/test_api.py', 'tests/unit/benchmark/test_engine.py', 'tests/unit/cmd/commands/test_task.py', 'rally/benchmark/sla/base.py', 'tests/unit/benchmark/sla/test_base.py', 'rally/cmd/commands/task.py', 'rally/benchmark/engine.py'], 'message': 'Abort scenario execution on SLA failure

* Change the api of the SLA classes:
  - add_iteration() - processes a single iteration result from the queue
  - result() - return the SLAResult based on the data processed so far.
    It now also returns a successful result in case there was no iterations
    data.

* Add a new SLAChecker class:
  - add_iteration() - processes a single iteration result with different SLAs
  - results() - return cumulative SLA results for all SLAs

* Change the benchmark engine so that it supports scenario runner aborts
  on SLA failure

* Support the "abort on SLA failure" feature in the CLI:
    rally task start ... --abort-on-sla-failure

* Modify the SLA detailed messages (cleaner text and less decimal places)

* Update unit and functional tests correspondingly. Also remove the usage of the
  deprecated "max_failure_percent" SLA from the functional tests.

Change-Id: I91894a81649815428fd1ac7afcfce9cf47160fc9
'}]
commit_message:
Abort scenario execution on SLA failure

* Change the api of the SLA classes:
  - add_iteration() - processes a single iteration result from the queue
  - result() - return the SLAResult based on the data processed so far.
    It now also returns a successful result in case there was no iterations
    data.

* Add a new SLAChecker class:
  - add_iteration() - processes a single iteration result with different SLAs
  - results() - return cumulative SLA results for all SLAs

* Change the benchmark engine so that it supports scenario runner aborts
  on SLA failure

* Support the "abort on SLA failure" feature in the CLI:
    rally task start ... --abort-on-sla-failure

* Modify the SLA detailed messages (cleaner text and less decimal places)

* Update unit and functional tests correspondingly. Also remove the usage of the
  deprecated "max_failure_percent" SLA from the functional tests.

Change-Id: I91894a81649815428fd1ac7afcfce9cf47160fc9

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-12 12:56:06.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/storwize_svc/__init__.py', 'cinder/tests/test_storwize_svc.py'], 'message': 'Failed to discovery when iscsi multipath and CHAP both enabled

Storage server may be configured to protect target discovering phase with CHAP
authentication, in this case existing discovery command will be failed in Nova
when iscsi multipath enabled. Nova need these below discovery auth properties.
    "discovery.sendtargets.auth.authmethod",
    "discovery.sendtargets.auth.username",
    "discovery.sendtargets.auth.password"

Cinder Storage driver need to send discovery auth properties to Nova in this
case and the properties are:
   iscsi_properties['discovery_auth_method']
   iscsi_properties['discovery_auth_username']
   iscsi_properties['discovery_auth_password']

This issue not just for IBM Storwize, but also other storage drivers who need
CHAP authentication to do iscsi discover.
The according nova change: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/148516/

Closes-Bug: #1367189

Change-Id: Ib528eed3a9fd5006c1649ef42233e1f943c38ab6
(cherry picked from commit 3f781f32d0aaa6adf9ef6c54ab6114de92b64917)
'}]
commit_message:
Failed to discovery when iscsi multipath and CHAP both enabled

Storage server may be configured to protect target discovering phase with CHAP
authentication, in this case existing discovery command will be failed in Nova
when iscsi multipath enabled. Nova need these below discovery auth properties.
    "discovery.sendtargets.auth.authmethod",
    "discovery.sendtargets.auth.username",
    "discovery.sendtargets.auth.password"

Cinder Storage driver need to send discovery auth properties to Nova in this
case and the properties are:
   iscsi_properties['discovery_auth_method']
   iscsi_properties['discovery_auth_username']
   iscsi_properties['discovery_auth_password']

This issue not just for IBM Storwize, but also other storage drivers who need
CHAP authentication to do iscsi discover.
The according nova change: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/148516/

Closes-Bug: #1367189

Change-Id: Ib528eed3a9fd5006c1649ef42233e1f943c38ab6

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-02-11 06:27:57.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/cmd/api.py', 'requirements.txt', 'ceilometer/api/app.py', 'ceilometer/api/__init__.py', 'ceilometer/tests/api/test_app.py', 'doc/source/install/mod_wsgi.rst'], 'message': "Use werkzeug to run the developement API server

wsgi.simple_server in a mono threaded process that can handle only
5 requests at a time.

Even the doc recommands to setup Ceilometer through an other WSGI services
like Apache 'mod_wsgi', we can provide a better testing API server.

So this patch changes the default HTTP server to the werkzeug one with
a autodiscovery of number of workers that we can use.

The client queue of werkzeug is 128, so on a 4 cpus machine, ceilometer-api
can now handle 512 connections instead of 5.

Also the change adds references of how to deploy pecan application in
the documentation.

The config option enable_reverse_dns_lookup can be safely removed,
because werkzeug doesn't do any reverse dns lookup.

DocImpact: configuration options changed:
enable_reverse_dns_lookup removed, api_workers added

Change-Id: If7450b393ea88bc185e5c82b706ace9c38ce350e
"}]
commit_message:
Use werkzeug to run the developement API server

wsgi.simple_server in a mono threaded process that can handle only
5 requests at a time.

Even the doc recommands to setup Ceilometer through an other WSGI services
like Apache 'mod_wsgi', we can provide a better testing API server.

So this patch changes the default HTTP server to the werkzeug one with
a autodiscovery of number of workers that we can use.

The client queue of werkzeug is 128, so on a 4 cpus machine, ceilometer-api
can now handle 512 connections instead of 5.

Also the change adds references of how to deploy pecan application in
the documentation.

The config option enable_reverse_dns_lookup can be safely removed,
because werkzeug doesn't do any reverse dns lookup.

DocImpact: configuration options changed:
enable_reverse_dns_lookup removed, api_workers added

Change-Id: If7450b393ea88bc185e5c82b706ace9c38ce350e

commit_message:
Creating Zookeeper symlink folder name to not use version

If we use the version in the folder name, whenever there is an update in
the zookeeper version we will need to update the plugins. Using a
symlink will keep the plugins isolaRemoving the
version keeps the plugin isolated from zookeeper changes.

Change-Id: Ia516286465fde0daff21be5398de7dd282868c15
Closes-bug: #1420830
