subject: Fix PyMySQL reference error detection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-13 01:53:30.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/sqlalchemy/exc_filters.py'], 'message': 'Fix PyMySQL reference error detection

When PyMySQL experiences a constraing error a unicode string prefix is
prepended part way through the inner_exception string. As a result, we
raise a DBError when we should be raising a DBReferenceError.

Change-Id: I5de1333d933bd28ca535852f4643df2ebbc7f964
'}]
commit_message:
Fix PyMySQL reference error detection

When PyMySQL experiences a constraing error a unicode string prefix is
prepended part way through the inner_exception string. As a result, we
raise a DBError when we should be raising a DBReferenceError.

Change-Id: I5de1333d933bd28ca535852f4643df2ebbc7f964

commit_message:
Refactored unit test cases to improve coverage

The patch set handles additional exception in
agent/ovsdb/connection.py
The patch set also contains minor fixes in unit test
cases to prevent printing of warnings/errors
in the output while running unit test cases.
Also, includes additional test cases to improve
the coverage with respect to [1].

1. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/154806

Change-Id: Ib21139d6850a947f12e43517d1c79ddf78a4495d

commit_message:
Adds a fork of python-ldap for Py3 testing

This is a temporary change to test the Python 3 python-ldap patches
against Keystone. The plan is to help get these Python 3 patches merged
upstream so that we can just upgrade for Py3 support.

https://mail.python.org/pipermail/python-ldap/2014q1/003348.html

bp python3

Change-Id: I43e644f98a14b0788f708a20e87c45d8d5bd1d8c

The port config values were being coerced to ints, but this is
unnecessary since the config options are defined as IntOpt already.

commit_message:
Add new "RoleAssignment" exception

Currently, basic role not found exception and role assignment with
specific role cannot be found are mixed up together, add "RoleAssignment"
exception to differentiate from the basic role exception will help
reducing the confusion.

Closes-Bug: #1418398
Change-Id: Ifcaad4a92f51a6bc0e4ac2394805af9e1a4c2a1c

subject: Fix evaluation logic of federation mapping rules
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-29 05:29:58.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/contrib/federation/utils.py', 'keystone/tests/test_v3_federation.py', 'keystone/tests/mapping_fixtures.py'], 'message': 'Fix evaluation logic of federation mapping rules

In the evaluation of federation mapping rules, when "regex" is true,
it's only checked that if the values from assertion match the values
from mapping rules, and "any_one_of" and "not_any_of" options are
bypassed. So if one specifies "regex: True" and "not_any_of" at the
same time, he will got an unexpected result that assertion with values
in "not_any_of" can pass the evaluation.

The expected behaviour, when "regex" is true, should be matching values
in assertion and mapping rules using regular expression, if match with
"any_one_of" or not match with "not_any_of", pass the evaluation,
otherwise fail the evaluation.

Change-Id: Ic6969c6dc23cff3abce775711f9ed01ffdf8dcb1
Closes-Bug: #1414961
'}]
commit_message:
Fix evaluation logic of federation mapping rules

In the evaluation of federation mapping rules, when "regex" is true,
it's only checked that if the values from assertion match the values
from mapping rules, and "any_one_of" and "not_any_of" options are
bypassed. So if one specifies "regex: True" and "not_any_of" at the
same time, he will got an unexpected result that assertion with values
in "not_any_of" can pass the evaluation.

The expected behaviour, when "regex" is true, should be matching values
in assertion and mapping rules using regular expression, if match with
"any_one_of" or not match with "not_any_of", pass the evaluation,
otherwise fail the evaluation.

Change-Id: Ic6969c6dc23cff3abce775711f9ed01ffdf8dcb1
Closes-Bug: #1414961

commit_message:
Add ratelimit to v2.1 API

We support ratelimit in v2 API, and we can support in v2.1
as well. So this patch adds the v2.1 support same to v2.

Partially implements v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I466f7f2d5baad85d81ccfe117a48df3dd5492868

commit_message:
Streamline drop-downs UX

* Hide drop-downs with no elements and enlarge button
* Auto-select the single available option in a drop-down
* Use the same icon for add-select as in 'Add to Env' button

Once the drop-down transitions from no elements -> single element, it
becames visible and add button becames small.

Change-Id: Ic39ec42621d2b0998fda23bdf781e26d6412c3b0

commit_message:
Make remove_service_catalog private

This is a utility function that is used for reducing the amount of data
that is logged. It shouldn't be a public function.

I think there is very little risk from this in terms of compatibility as
it was only added recently.

commit_message:
AgentVendorInterface: Move to a common place

This patch is moving the common pieces of the AgentVendorInterface to
a common place and into a new class called BaseAgentVendor which can
be overwritten and used by other drivers using IPA as their deployment
ramdisk.

The tests were also splitted and a new test_deploy_is_done() have been
added to the AgentVendorInterface test case.

This patch is a forklift, when IPA becomes the default ramdisk for
all drivers we might want to promote many of it's methods (e.g lookup,
heartbeat, ...) to the BaseVendor class.

Change-Id: I1e8af0c9a5f68e60f81a408defdbdf8c4d813d4e

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-02-13 07:24:44.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/auth/controllers.py', 'keystone/hacking/checks.py', 'keystone/tests/ksfixtures/hacking.py', 'keystone/auth/plugins/token.py', 'keystone/common/wsgi.py', 'keystone/auth/plugins/password.py'], 'message': 'Log exceptions safely

The Python standard library logging module expects to be given a string
as the first argument to all of the log methods. If it receives
something that is not a string, it tries to convert it to a string. The
old logging ContextAdapter dealt with this transparently by using
unicode(), but oslo.log on longer uses the ContextAdapter. Since the
underlying code is using the equivalent of str(), we need to pass real
string objects in to the log calls, instead of passing just exception
objects.

Change-Id: I0bc3b1e9761441178cb5400559c6a84a6fb33f06
'}]
commit_message:
Log exceptions safely

The Python standard library logging module expects to be given a string
as the first argument to all of the log methods. If it receives
something that is not a string, it tries to convert it to a string. The
old logging ContextAdapter dealt with this transparently by using
unicode(), but oslo.log on longer uses the ContextAdapter. Since the
underlying code is using the equivalent of str(), we need to pass real
string objects in to the log calls, instead of passing just exception
objects.

Change-Id: I0bc3b1e9761441178cb5400559c6a84a6fb33f06

The functional testing of some projects (notably Neutron) relies on

commit_message:
Conditionally skip installation of python packages

The functional testing of some projects (notably Neutron) relies on
deployment to a tox env and there is no point in installing python
dependencies system-wide in such cases.  This change adds an optional
flag to install_prereqs.sh that skips installation of python-*
packages (with the exception of python-dev*).

Change-Id: If8569a20f3e85ec0345124b311ad9b214e8af7ba

Warnings issued using the Python warning module were printed to
standard error which is useless when the keystone server is run as

Change-Id: I5a51116e4b0f54f5e26d611e7fd72e8a983ede7f

commit_message:
Integrate logging with the warnings module

Warnings issued using the Python warning module were printed to
standard error which is useless when the keystone server is run as
a daemon. Turn the capture of warnings by logging on so that warnings
are logged using the normal OpenStack logging mechanism.

Change-Id: I5a51116e4b0f54f5e26d611e7fd72e8a983ede7f

commit_message:
Change the default digest for pki/ssl_setup to sha256

The default digest was `default`, which meant that the digest was the
openssl default which may be sha1 or sha256 or better. Keystone will
now set the default digest to sha256, which conforms to most security
policies.

This is for security hardening.

SecurityImpact

DocImpact

The `default_message_digest` configuration options now default to
`sha256` instead of `default`.

Change-Id: I9e42c9bafc307ba1334fa641bab76f251722044d
Related-Bug: #1362343

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-12-31 16:23:10.000000000', 'files': ['etc/keystone.conf.sample', 'keystone/tests/test_cert_setup.py', 'keystone/common/config.py', 'keystone/common/openssl.py'], 'message': "pki/ssl_setup configurable digest

The digest to use for pki_setup couldn't be configured. The value was
`default`, which on some systems means that the digest was sha1. Some
security standards require the digest to be stronger (SHA2), so making
the digest configurable will allow deployments to be compliant.

SecurityImpact

DocImpact

New `message_digest_algorithm` configuration options are added to the
[signing] and [ssl] sections which default to `default`.

Change-Id: I241ca72329f1ec9df778498b346d7b29c224d528
Closes-Bug: #1362343
"}]
commit_message:
pki/ssl_setup configurable digest

The digest to use for pki_setup couldn't be configured. The value was
`default`, which on some systems means that the digest was sha1. Some
security standards require the digest to be stronger (SHA2), so making
the digest configurable will allow deployments to be compliant.

SecurityImpact

DocImpact

New `message_digest_algorithm` configuration options are added to the
[signing] and [ssl] sections which default to `default`.

Change-Id: I241ca72329f1ec9df778498b346d7b29c224d528
Closes-Bug: #1362343

subject: Declare queue in publisher also
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-30 18:57:57.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': "Declare queue in publisher also

If rabbit dies, the consumer can be disconnected before the publisher
sends, and if the consumer hasn't declared the queue, the publisher's
will send a message to an exchange that's not bound to a queue, and
the message will be lost. So let's create queue on both sides to
prevent loosing messages.

Note that fanout queues don't have the proper info on the sending
side to redeclare the queue in the same way, so leave the old behavior
for fanout queues.

Change-Id: Ic626a0f2e2bd7fade02a192dd2c23140762201cd
Closes-Bug: 1338732
Co-Authored-By: Andrey Pavlov <andrey-mp@yandex.ru>
"}]
commit_message:
Declare queue in publisher also

If rabbit dies, the consumer can be disconnected before the publisher
sends, and if the consumer hasn't declared the queue, the publisher's
will send a message to an exchange that's not bound to a queue, and
the message will be lost. So let's create queue on both sides to
prevent loosing messages.

Note that fanout queues don't have the proper info on the sending
side to redeclare the queue in the same way, so leave the old behavior
for fanout queues.

Change-Id: Ic626a0f2e2bd7fade02a192dd2c23140762201cd
Closes-Bug: 1338732
Co-Authored-By: Andrey Pavlov <andrey-mp@yandex.ru>

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-01-15 22:16:30.000000000', 'files': ['elements/neutron-openvswitch-agent/bin/init-neutron-ovs'], 'message': 'Fix indentation errors in init-neutron-ovs

Prior to this change, init-neutron-ovs would generate an
neutron-openvswitch-agent.conf with various indentation errors. In one
example, something that looked approximately like this was seen:

  - type: ovs-bridge
    members:
      - type: interface
    use_dhcp: true
      - type: vlan
        vlan_id: 1234

which fails on the "type: vlan" line as that's not a legal place to have
a mapping.

I think this change makes this snippet revert to the original intent
here; if I've done it correctly, "- type: vlan" should be at the same
level as "- type: interface ", as part of the "members:" list

Change-Id: I5cea0545928d0bb47c37a6f4fd4c5687e323b99d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix indentation errors in init-neutron-ovs

Prior to this change, init-neutron-ovs would generate an
neutron-openvswitch-agent.conf with various indentation errors. In one
example, something that looked approximately like this was seen:

  - type: ovs-bridge
    members:
      - type: interface
    use_dhcp: true
      - type: vlan
        vlan_id: 1234

which fails on the "type: vlan" line as that's not a legal place to have
a mapping.

I think this change makes this snippet revert to the original intent
here; if I've done it correctly, "- type: vlan" should be at the same
level as "- type: interface ", as part of the "members:" list

Change-Id: I5cea0545928d0bb47c37a6f4fd4c5687e323b99d

commit_message:
Fix the STATIC_ROOT after overwriting local_settings.py

Horizon does some post-processing on local_settings.py file, and we
are overwriting that here, so we have to repeat that operation. Line
copied from:

https://github.com/redhat-openstack/tripleo-image-elements/blob/master-patches/elements/horizon/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/14-horizon#L22

Change-Id: I96331c8c977cad2d5aee237c17e34ff866ef9959

commit_message:
Add the rebinding chance in _bind_port_if_needed

Make function _bind_port_if_needed to bind at least one time when the port's
binding status passed in is already in binding_failed.

Change-Id: I823ff5ca66833cdca459f13ab28f5075ae03ded3
Closes-Bug: #1399249

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-13 04:09:09.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/data_processing/v1_1/data_processing_client.py', 'tempest/clients.py'], 'message': "Rename data_processing client

The client module name of data_processing was just 'client', but
the other service clients contain their service names.
So the one of data_processing was different and inconsistent.
This patch renames the module name to data_processing_client.

Change-Id: Iefd04a5e22ea3943ef368fb8d27a0a4a28a75f8b

commit_message:
Rename data_processing client

The client module name of data_processing was just 'client', but
the other service clients contain their service names.
So the one of data_processing was different and inconsistent.
This patch renames the module name to data_processing_client.

Change-Id: Iefd04a5e22ea3943ef368fb8d27a0a4a28a75f8b

Add vcpu_model to instance object

features, the cpu model and is saved as extra for the instance object.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-05 23:13:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/openstack/common/loopingcall.py', 'nova/openstack/common/periodic_task.py', 'nova/openstack/common/policy.py', 'nova/openstack/common/report/generators/process.py', 'nova/openstack/common/eventlet_backdoor.py', 'nova/openstack/common/report/models/process.py', 'nova/openstack/common/versionutils.py', 'requirements.txt', 'nova/openstack/common/report/views/text/process.py', 'nova/openstack/common/report/guru_meditation_report.py', 'nova/openstack/common/service.py', 'nova/openstack/common/fileutils.py', 'nova/openstack/common/systemd.py', 'nova/openstack/common/threadgroup.py'], 'message': 'Sync with oslo-incubator

Changes include:
ac17de9 Use oslo_utils instead of deprecated oslo.utils...
1c1bf07 Report: Add basic processes section...
2aacb11 Change oslo.config to oslo_config...
2fbf506 Remove oslo.log code and clean up versionutils API...
2fbf506 Remove oslo.log code and clean up versionutils API...
fbd77a7 Allow overriding name for periodic tasks...
9896e0e Separate add_periodic_task from the metaclass __init__...

commit_message:
Write share_helpers to config as CSV

Currently, the share_helpers parameter is implemented
in the manifest as a list, but the list is written
directly to the config file.  It needs to be written
as a comma-separated list instead.

Change-Id: Ic57c4e78567712397aff9550036f8feb772ad4d5

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1941, 'name': 'Lin Hua Cheng', 'email': 'os.lcheng@gmail.com', 'username': 'lin-hua-cheng'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4264, 'name': 'Matthias Runge', 'email': 'mrunge@redhat.com', 'username': 'mrunge'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}, {'_account_id': 7665, 'name': 'Travis Tripp', 'email': 'os.travis.tripp@gmail.com', 'username': 'travis.tripp'}, {'_account_id': 9659, 'name': 'Matt Wood', 'email': 'matt.wood@hpe.com', 'username': 'woodm1979'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-01-09 01:14:40.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Remove old deprecated xstatic angular packages

Xstatic-Angular 1.3.7 includes the following packages:

XStatic-Angular-Cookies
XStatic-Angular-Mock

They can now be removed.  This had to be done
in a multi-step process because of the interdependency chain,
being blocked by integration checks (horizon has dependency)
on these packages.

1) The newer pakage has to be added to global requirements
2) a) The new dependency has to be added to Horizon
   b) Old dependencies must be removed from Horizon
3) The older packages must be removed from global requirements

At least this is the best way that I can tell how to make it all
work since I can't modify the requirements across projects
in the same patch set.

Partially Implements: blueprint launch-instance-redesign

Change-Id: Ib5b1d03922af8a8419a690f84d9b639bbecb10a9
"}]
commit_message:
Remove old deprecated xstatic angular packages

Xstatic-Angular 1.3.7 includes the following packages:

XStatic-Angular-Cookies
XStatic-Angular-Mock

They can now be removed.  This had to be done
in a multi-step process because of the interdependency chain,
being blocked by integration checks (horizon has dependency)
on these packages.

1) The newer pakage has to be added to global requirements
2) a) The new dependency has to be added to Horizon
   b) Old dependencies must be removed from Horizon
3) The older packages must be removed from global requirements

At least this is the best way that I can tell how to make it all
work since I can't modify the requirements across projects
in the same patch set.

Partially Implements: blueprint launch-instance-redesign

Change-Id: Ib5b1d03922af8a8419a690f84d9b639bbecb10a9

Identity id mapping is used to create public ids for local entities,

creating a hash of the local identifiers - but this hashing did

commit_message:
Make identity id mapping handle unicode

Identity id mapping is used to create public ids for local entities,
typically stored in LDAP backends. Part of the mapping involves
creating a hash of the local identifiers - but this hashing did
not correctly handle unicode. This patch fixes this.

(cherry picked from commit Icc2a6bc4a7e88004bbe6f86d3a96cff07be4c6f9)
Closes-Bug: 1419187

Change-Id: I308bae4f2743d573c57c34af808e16ce9bbd27f0

commit_message:
Improve testing of unicode id mapping

We currently don't test that our id mapping correctly supports
unicode - and in fact, it doesn't. This patch adds a test that
demonstrates this. A follow-on patch will fix the issue.

(cherry picked from commit Ief0597bbd0f1486f23eb799b68a85b590b7e35ef)
Partial-Bug: 1419187

Change-Id: I6b0b3ea1068e8839a974ad205e5059e5be7ac7b9

subject: Fix race on default role creation
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1941, 'name': 'Lin Hua Cheng', 'email': 'os.lcheng@gmail.com', 'username': 'lin-hua-cheng'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-07 02:24:39.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/assignment/core.py'], 'message': "Fix race on default role creation

In add_user_to_project() it checks if the default role exists before
trying to add the role to the user and project. If it doesn't exist it
will attempt to create the role. However if 2 requests happen at
roughly the same time the 2 role creations will race causing one to
fail with a conflict error. This patch addresses this issue by catching
the conflict exception and treating it as the create succeeded (which it
did just elsewhere)

Conflicts:
	keystone/assignment/core.py

Change-Id: Iab95ed8b3913c020eafa919231d764ba8b780571
Closes-Bug: #1419043
(cherry picked from commit 0b1027886ae6bc29abd86aa8ede499be5f5fc2ae)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix race on default role creation

In add_user_to_project() it checks if the default role exists before
trying to add the role to the user and project. If it doesn't exist it
will attempt to create the role. However if 2 requests happen at
roughly the same time the 2 role creations will race causing one to
fail with a conflict error. This patch addresses this issue by catching
the conflict exception and treating it as the create succeeded (which it
did just elsewhere)

Conflicts:
	keystone/assignment/core.py

Change-Id: Iab95ed8b3913c020eafa919231d764ba8b780571
Closes-Bug: #1419043
(cherry picked from commit 0b1027886ae6bc29abd86aa8ede499be5f5fc2ae)

commit_message:
Ensure designate user/group exist

Without the ensure line, Puppet will only try to manage the attributes
on these resources.  This issue only occurs if the system packages don't
create the users.

Change-Id: Id46f06a03c31c1dd29971fec21703715744ab8d5

commit_message:
Add in python-openstacksdk to requirements.txt

The python-openstacksdk has matured enough to integrate it into a few
projects.  I currently working on a couple proof of concepts for its
use.

* The library is activily maintained and supported by a fairly
  large community.
  https://github.com/stackforge/python-openstacksdk/graphs/contributors
* The library is good code.  We have extensive tests and examples and
  there was a proof of concept with the python-openstackclient in the
  past.
* The library is python 3 compatible, gates test this regularly.
* The library has an Apache license.
* The library is *not* packaged in any distros.
* There is no other library that is intended to be the one SDK for
  all the OpenStack projects.

Change-Id: Iaa3815e8ee11f72b90ab1180dcb4a70f4866614f

commit_message:
libvirt: utils canonicalize now the image architecture property

If the image has an architecture property, the libvirt utils did *not*
canonicalize that. The architecture switches in the libvirt driver
could then produce a wrong domain xml.
This patch canonicalizes the image architecture property.

Closes-Bug: 1418675

Change-Id: Ie88c8e79f6b31f48ad0e98215bd7f6dbca93119a

commit_message:
libvirt: memnodes shuold be set to a list instead of None

Currently, _get_guest_numa_tune_memnodes returns None,
when an installed version of Libvirt doesn't support a
memnode element in the numa tune configuration,
while it should always return a list.

Related-Bug: #1415333

Change-Id: I28a5a2c65aa703b0161ebca8659dc96a7b6c1bf6

This patch implements the part that reads the specified boot_option in
the node.instance_info['capabilities'] that have been passed to Ironic by
the Nova Ironic Driver and pass that information to the deploy ramdisk
by adding it to the kernel cmdline in the PXE configuration file that
will be generated to that node.

This patch also makes sure that we clean the PXE configuration files for
the node marked to local boot after it's deployed, so that any attempt
to boot it from the network will not work.

about adding local boot support for deployments that uses partition
images. The agent driver right now supports full disk images only.

Change-Id: Ide08e2b41dcf74c69dfbce242112da701fa15187
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for local boot

This patch implements the part that reads the specified boot_option in
the node.instance_info['capabilities'] that have been passed to Ironic by
the Nova Ironic Driver and pass that information to the deploy ramdisk
by adding it to the kernel cmdline in the PXE configuration file that
will be generated to that node.

This patch also makes sure that we clean the PXE configuration files for
the node marked to local boot after it's deployed, so that any attempt
to boot it from the network will not work.

This patch only apply to the pxe_* drivers, because the blueprint is
about adding local boot support for deployments that uses partition
images. The agent driver right now supports full disk images only.

Implements: blueprint local-boot-support-with-partition-images
Change-Id: Ide08e2b41dcf74c69dfbce242112da701fa15187

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Adds instance missing metrics enabling

Adds the enabling of the 'Aggregated Average Memory Utilization'
metrics for each instance and updates unit test to make sure it
is enabled.

This commit is needed in order for the Hyper-V ceilometer compute
agent to report the instance average memory utilization metrics.

Change-Id: If24294c4d2a325d76fbb01d675cc4c34bfc2e5fb

building a fake ipv4 network, and so the easiest way to test against a
fake ipv6 network is to manually create ipv6 components (subnets,
routes, ips) and plug them into the default fake VIF. This makes testing
ipv6 functionality rather error-prone and laborious.

This patch adds an option to create ipv6 models.

Change-Id: I9aacbc45ce79cab05c6611d38fc2daaf2ba5dab7
Co-Authored-By: Ellen Hui <ellenfkh@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1336094
'}]
commit_message:
Add ipv6 support to fake network models

Currently, the functions in fake_network_cache_model all default to
building a fake ipv4 network, and so the easiest way to test against a
fake ipv6 network is to manually create ipv6 components (subnets,
routes, ips) and plug them into the default fake VIF. This makes testing
ipv6 functionality rather error-prone and laborious.

This patch adds an option to create ipv6 models.

Change-Id: I9aacbc45ce79cab05c6611d38fc2daaf2ba5dab7
Co-Authored-By: Ellen Hui <ellenfkh@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1336094

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-12 14:06:41.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/nova_api_spec.rb', 'manifests/compute.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_compute_spec.rb', 'manifests/api.pp', 'lib/puppet/parser/functions/check_array_of_hash.rb'], 'message': "Add PCI Passthrough/SR-IOV support

The main issue with INI files, it doesn't support complex structures
which end up being declared as strings. This approach get that chain of
character and verify it's a valid JSON equivalent before assigning the
value.

Another driver is even though Hiera supports complex structure, we tend
to keep it simple when using Hiera interpolations.

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/SR-IOV-Passthrough-For-Networking#SR-IOV_Configuration

Change-Id: I27d43af13fcc80f41a16c31a0a6cfe112dc96acb
(cherry picked from commit c671ad7d2544e4e6fb54f10d917d2137618a2869)
"}]
commit_message:
Add PCI Passthrough/SR-IOV support

The main issue with INI files, it doesn't support complex structures
which end up being declared as strings. This approach get that chain of
character and verify it's a valid JSON equivalent before assigning the
value.

Another driver is even though Hiera supports complex structure, we tend
to keep it simple when using Hiera interpolations.

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/SR-IOV-Passthrough-For-Networking#SR-IOV_Configuration

Change-Id: I27d43af13fcc80f41a16c31a0a6cfe112dc96acb
(cherry picked from commit c671ad7d2544e4e6fb54f10d917d2137618a2869)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-12-07 15:53:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/network/test_network_info.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_xenapi.py', 'nova/virt/interfaces.template', 'nova/virt/netutils.py'], 'message': 'Fixes interfaces template identification issue

When using networks without DHCP enabled and "flat_injected" set to True,
the interfaces template is injected in the associated instances or
included in the config drive metadata.

The template includes the interface name, based on a progressive numbering
(eth0, eth1, etc). In case of multiple nics, there's no clear way to
identify the interfaces in the guest OS if the actual interface naming
differs, this is especially valid for Windows instances.

Since the MAC address (hardware address) assigned to each vNIC identifies
uniquely the interface, providing the mac address during the template
generation solves the issue.

Change-Id: Id82db6d83caedf0e95f882d909b77ea9b98b2547
Closes-Bug: #1400080
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes interfaces template identification issue

When using networks without DHCP enabled and "flat_injected" set to True,
the interfaces template is injected in the associated instances or
included in the config drive metadata.

The template includes the interface name, based on a progressive numbering
(eth0, eth1, etc). In case of multiple nics, there's no clear way to
identify the interfaces in the guest OS if the actual interface naming
differs, this is especially valid for Windows instances.

Since the MAC address (hardware address) assigned to each vNIC identifies
uniquely the interface, providing the mac address during the template
generation solves the issue.

Change-Id: Id82db6d83caedf0e95f882d909b77ea9b98b2547
Closes-Bug: #1400080

commit_message:
Persisting dependency graph & resource versioning.

Persisting dependency task graphs and versioning of resources is
fundamental need for convergence. This spec covers these two aspects.

This spec is subsidiary of Convergence Specification.
Convergence Specification: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/95907/7

Change-Id: I09710d6fd06b9249a7ce112fa1aabdf810f38380

commit_message:
Run noop testing via rake spec

WORK IN PROGRESS

We can run noop tests via 'rake spec'. This will allow us to:

  - Make sure that catalog compiles and there are no dependency
    cycles in the graph.
  - Use RSpec tests to check that needed puppet resources present
    in the catalog for specific astute.yaml configuration.

In order to test just execute these commands:
  export WORKSPACE=/tmp/fuel_noop_tests
  mkdir -p $WORKSPACE
  ./utils/jenkins/fuel_noop_tests.sh

Related-bug: #1402738
Implement blueprint deployment-dryrun

Fuel CI temporarily disabled since this change does not affect
MOS deplyoment process, only CI itself.

Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: I5a3b569e86d8838d5c20b590cc6cc106fb2242a7

The patch defines the following complex cases for
create-update-delete stack scenario in rally tests for Heat:
Case 1:
- Heat creates a stack
- Heat updates the stack (stack resource is updating
and children resource is creating during stack-update)
- Heat deletes the stack
Case 2:
- Heat creates a stack
- Heat updates the stack (stack resource is updating and children
resource is deleting during stack-update)
- Heat deletes the stack

Change-Id: I9d420b316ce38fd73f8eb74c0be253ed1a20f7db
'}]
commit_message:
Add update + add/delete resource cases

The patch defines the following complex cases for
create-update-delete stack scenario in rally tests for Heat:
Case 1:
- Heat creates a stack
- Heat updates the stack (stack resource is updating
and children resource is creating during stack-update)
- Heat deletes the stack
Case 2:
- Heat creates a stack
- Heat updates the stack (stack resource is updating and children
resource is deleting during stack-update)
- Heat deletes the stack

Change-Id: I9d420b316ce38fd73f8eb74c0be253ed1a20f7db

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-02-12 15:12:15.000000000', 'files': ['tools/gate/build-images', 'diskimage-create/README.rst', 'diskimage-create/diskimage-create.sh'], 'message': 'Adding new update option to diskimage-create.sh

This change removes the global system updates in favor of only updating
the required packages for diskimage creation. Additionally the script
will not automatically install the updates but will warn the user if the
packages are not installed. A switch is provided to allow the script to
install the updates.

Changes
* adding function to detect an installed package
* adding function to check for a list of installed packages
* adding command line switch for updating (-u)
* removing global update commands
* refactoring update logic to fail gracefully or accept switch
* adding -u switch to build-images gate tool
* adding note in documentation about update command line switch

Closes-Bug: 1375843
Change-Id: Iba5e676fa8ef7a852b71acd9e4c19d32f848285a
'}]
commit_message:
Adding new update option to diskimage-create.sh

This change removes the global system updates in favor of only updating
the required packages for diskimage creation. Additionally the script
will not automatically install the updates but will warn the user if the
packages are not installed. A switch is provided to allow the script to
install the updates.

Changes
* adding function to detect an installed package
* adding function to check for a list of installed packages
* adding command line switch for updating (-u)
* removing global update commands
* refactoring update logic to fail gracefully or accept switch
* adding -u switch to build-images gate tool
* adding note in documentation about update command line switch

Closes-Bug: 1375843
Change-Id: Iba5e676fa8ef7a852b71acd9e4c19d32f848285a

commit_message:
Remove unused RPC functions from l3_rpc and agent

This patch depends on "Change-id: #153735". The
patch in the change-id shown above removes the
dependency on the rpc for getting the FloatingIP
Agent Gateway port from the plugin.

Now the RPC function calls can be cleaned up.
This patch cleans the unused RPC.

Change-Id: Ie49dcea3886b2894426646503b7d40126464299d
Related-Bug: #1415522

commit_message:
[install-guide] keystone-manage pki_setup not necessary for openSUSE/SLES

With Juno it is not longer necessary to manually run keystone-manage
pki_setup on openSUSE/SLES. keystone-manage pki_setup is part of
the post section of the openstack-keystone package.

commit_message:
[install-guide] do not synchronize Keystone DB on openSUSE/SLES

It is not necessary to manually synchronize the Keystone DB on
openSUSE/SLES because keystone-manage db_sync is part of the
init file.

Change-Id: I54891efe30db0dfc22777845d842956dab10c559
(cherry picked from commit cd4581a1331708b088c35c1a846d23360fc705f7)

subject: [install-guide] Add note about the hourly Keystone cronjob for SUSE
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-12 20:07:05.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_keystone-install.xml'], 'message': '[install-guide] Add note about the hourly Keystone cronjob for SUSE

The openstack-keystone package for openSUSE/SLES provides the cronjob
file /etc/cron.hourly/openstack-keystone. It is not necessary to
manually add a cronjob.

Change-Id: Id40f28070380cced861f593772ee9f7cdbecbe14
(cherry picked from commit 5f45d98e88417f135032810be184406645d29818)
'}]
commit_message:
[install-guide] Add note about the hourly Keystone cronjob for SUSE

The openstack-keystone package for openSUSE/SLES provides the cronjob
file /etc/cron.hourly/openstack-keystone. It is not necessary to
manually add a cronjob.

Change-Id: Id40f28070380cced861f593772ee9f7cdbecbe14
(cherry picked from commit 5f45d98e88417f135032810be184406645d29818)

commit_message:
Migrate sync_time into granular deployment taks

* modified shell_hook to take new params to make retries of commands
* remove SyncTime from pre deployment actions for granular deployment
  because it is now implemented as taks

implements blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks

Change-Id: I43da4b2382ad172fea27ca1abb7544a60fcd08cb

commit_message:
Add expire_logs_days = 10 to mysql configuration.

Settings expire_logs_days should be set in /etc/mysql/conf.d/wsrep.cnf to
prevent the logs fill the disk on the controller node.

Change-Id: Id4e50ef8e0b764a53a1aa5f819e562017616f7dd
Closes-Bug: 1420825

commit_message:
Implement local scripts for all gate tests

This patch implements the following:
 - scripts-library.sh which includes commonly used functions, variables
   and other preparation commands for all other scripts
 - bootstrap-ansible.sh which only deploys a selected version of ansible
   and ensures that any other requirements are prepared on the
   deployment host
 - bootstrap-aio.sh which runs all host preparation actions for an
   all-in-one build
 - gate-check-lint.sh which runs a lint and syntax check
 - gate-check-commit.sh which runs all actions required for a gate
   commit check, utilising the other scripts where required
 - run-smoke-test.sh which runs tempest from inside the utility container
 - run-playbooks.sh which runs the playbooks
 - the existing conf.d/swift.yml is renamed to be an example
   configuration - the example configurations can be used as
   documentation
 - etc/network/interfaces.d/aio_interfaces.cfg,
   etc/rpc_deploy/conf.d/swift.yml and
   etc/rpc_deploy/rpc_user_config.yml are now configurations used for
   the AIO deployment
 - a workaround for https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1244589 to ensure
   that DHCP checksums are implemented by the host which is required for
   the smoke tests to work
 - the removal of the rpc heat templates as they're unusable in their
   current state
 - setting MAX_RETRIES to 0, ensuring that any failures cause an
   immediate commit check failure in the gate - this prevents the
   masking of failures by retry attempts

DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
Closes-Bug: #1415883
Closes-Bug: #1417999
Closes-Bug: #1419807
Change-Id: I95242d48ad0fb055f16510803c8aa14dc183ac17
